title: Software Engineer - Early Careers
description:
**About The Role**
**Important note:** 
 Please remember to include your grade transcript along with your CV when submitting your application.
   

  

**The team:** 
 Our team consists of 8-10 engineers and is responsible for a web-based application for delivery of optimization services for large financial institutions. We value working with passionate, talented and nice people who have fun together while pushing ourselves and our systems to improve continuously. Our architecture is clean and modern and based upon patterns like automated testing, modulation, clear boundaries and clear responsibilities, and we believe in continuous and iterative delivery, fail fast, prototyping and continuous feedback from internal and external clients.
   

  

**The impact:** 
 OSTTRA has the largest financial institutions in the world as clients, and our optimization businesses are the largest banks in the world specifically. Our optimization services deliver significant impacts on clients' portfolio compositions and operational costs, and when we run our services, global metrics of systemic risks in the financial markets move to a high degree. We believe that long-term value to the client is the most important goal of our team, and technology is the tool to bring that value, and your contribution in the form of delivery, improvements and innovations can have a significant impact on the financial system.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
 We strongly believe in individual growth and have long experience in guiding early careers engineers in our modern approach to software production, which includes:
   

  

* Rapid, iterative and phased delivery, backed by automated testing and deployment frameworks
* Streamlined, autonomous and independent teams, optimised and supported for fast change
* Clean architecture for maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with the team structures and with clear boundaries and responsibilities
* Innovative culture with a strong focus on exploration and prototyping, where failing fast is a virtue which drives technological and product improvements.


 We’ve worked with many students and hired several who joined originally during their studies - so this could be the place you activate your career.
   

  

**Early Career Software Engineer Position Profile**
 We are seeking a newly graduated student to join our innovative and forward-thinking team as a Software Engineer during the summer of 2024. Our company is at the forefront of rapid, iterative, and phased delivery, backed by cutting-edge automated testing and deployment frameworks. We believe in streamlined, autonomous, and independent teams that are optimised and supported for swift adaptability. Our commitment to clean architecture ensures maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with team structures and defined responsibilities.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to the success of our projects with a
   

  

 focus on talent, passion, and grit. While no prior work experience is required, we are looking for candidates who hold a Master's degree in Computer Science. We foster an innovative culture that places a strong emphasis on exploration and prototyping. Here, failing fast is seen as a virtue, propelling technological and product improvements.
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional, autonomous teams for rapid and phased


 delivery
   

  

* Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability,


 and flexibility
   

  

* Contribute to an innovative culture through exploration, prototyping, and a


 willingness to take calculated risks
   

  

* Engage in continuous learning to stay abreast of the latest technologies and


 industry best practices
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
**What We're Looking For:**
* Master's degree in Computer Science
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for learning
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative


 environment
   

  

* Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute ideas to a diverse


 team
   

  

 If you are a tech enthusiast with a thirst for innovation and a desire to contribute to an exciting and fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us as we redefine the boundaries of technology and drive impactful change in the industry.
   

  

**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

title: Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Us**
 Sinch is a global leader in cloud communications, helping businesses connect with their customers on their mobile phones. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year. Our technology powers the world's leading communications platforms.
   

  

 We are a dynamic and innovative team seeking a passionate Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core) to collaborate on our cloud-based communication solutions that are built using the latest versions of C# and .NET Core hosted on AWS using cloud native technologies like Kubernetes and Docker.
   

  

 The working model is hybrid, and you can work from Stockholm or Malmo office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create systems that are not only scalable but also resilient, ensuring graceful failure.
* Manage the software lifecycle from design and development to testing and production deployment.
* Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, but primarily with C# and .NET Core.
* Actively contribute to enhancing our development processes and pipelines.
* Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
* Engage closely with software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional products.


**Requirements**
* Experienced professional in team-based development, deployment, and maintenance of software products in production.
* In-depth knowledge of .NET Core and a deep passion for technology.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and testable code.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical discipline.


**Good to have**
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Experience working with service-oriented architecture and distributed systems.
* Experience with Kubernetes or similar technologies.
* Experience working with AWS.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow developers empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


**Embrace the challenge and join us!**

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
**Position Type**
 Full time
   

  

**Type Of Hire**
 Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)
   

  

**Education Desired**
 Bachelor of Computer Engineering
   

  

**Travel Percentage**
 0%
   

  

 FIS is a leading global provider of financial software that powers the world's economy. We are a diverse team of innovators who are passionate about creating cutting-edge fintech products and solutions for our clients and communities. We are committed to championing diversity and creating an inclusive workplace.
   

  

 The FIS Cross-Asset Trading and Risk solution helps firms quickly enter new markets and support new strategies. We deliver real-time controls for trading, order management, profit & loss and position keeping with risk management, all on one platform for both sell-side and buy-side.
   

  

**About The Role**
**As a developer in our Market Integration** 
 team you will be challenged with a wide range of tasks, ranging from design, development and maintenance of our solution. The Market Integration team is responsible for the integration solution to exchanges globally as well as integration to alternative trading platforms and broker networks. The solution is based on back-end modules with very demanding requirements on low latency as well as high throughput. We have a test-driven development process, and the development is done with in-house developed frameworks using UML, pre-processing and a C like mapping language in parallel with standard C++ and Python.
   

  

 We will offer you challenges, where understanding market and customer requirements and solving problems is a key part, in combination with creating advanced technical solutions. You will be part of an Agile Scrum team with skilled and motivated developers and QA that take full responsibility for its solution which includes both working on continuous improvements as well as innovations. By working closely together with Senior Developers and the Product Owner in your Scrum team you will get a deep understanding of market needs.
   

  

**Position Requirements**
 We expect you to have the following~
   

  

* M Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering Physics or similar degree.
* Experience in an object-oriented language like Python or C++ is a plus.
* A great interest in learning the financial markets.
* Have capacity to deliver high quality software in a high pace environment.
* Good skills in English.


**In Addition To This We Believe That You**
* Have knowledge about tools like Jira, GitHub, containerization tools.
* Like to take initiatives and influence the direction of your own development.
* Have strong analytical thinking with an attitude that problems are to be solved.
* Are communicative and strongly like to work in a team and share knowledge with others.
* Are not afraid of challenging your colleagues in their mindset.


**What We Offer You**
 At FIS, we offer you the opportunity to shape the future of fintech. You will be part of an expansive phase in our continued journey. We believe in creating a workplace where ideas can flow freely and where every day is different. A career at FIS is more than just a job. We offer~
   

  

* A flexible work-life where we embrace the mix of working digitally and from the office
* A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities
* A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility and respect
* The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services and technology
* A voice in the future of one of the World's largest Fintech organizations


**Privacy Statement**
 FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice .
   

  

**Sourcing Model**
 Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.
   

  

 #pridepass

title: Java Developer
description:
**Job Description**
 Would you like to work in an internationally agile driven environment on solutions used in various parts of the world? Do you consider yourself a proactive, self-driven colleague who can take full ownership of the initiative working both independently and as part of a group?
   

  

 In this role, you will collaborate with a set of brilliant people co-tackling a variety of technical challenges and driven by a shared ambition to create hassle-free, efficient, and scalable solutions. You will join a diverse team in our Center of Excellence where you will work closely with the product to design and build features. You will be involved not only in backend development but also with testing, deployment, monitoring, architecture, code reviews, pair, and mob programming, etc. You will work with your peers across teams to make platform improvements and increase learning opportunities for everyone in a collaborative and nurturing environment. You will be actively encouraged to have open communication, respect diverse opinions and ideas, and demonstrate willingness to work together to create a positive and supportive culture that fosters innovation and creativity. This is an exciting opportunity to join our newly created community of talented developers supporting various product teams within the organization, which certainly will give you the opportunity to grow professionally.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Qualifications:
   

  

* Between 2 to 6 years of hands-on experience working with continuously delivered systems
* Advanced level knowledge in Java, preferably 21 or at least 15 and above
* Good knowledge on Azure, specifically Logic App, Service Bus, Function App, Storage Account
* Knowledge of REST architecture (Express/HAPI/similar) and building APIs
* Prior working experience with Spring Boot
* Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests
* User authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments
* Experience with database management (Cosmos DB, PostgreSQL, MySQL)
* Experience working with agile teams, planning, refining, delivering, and inspecting sprint deliveries
* A genuine learning and knowledge sharing energy
* Proactiveness and will-do attitude
* Interest in or experience with Retail Industry


**Additional Information**
**Company Description** 
 .
   

  

 Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, flexible work life, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits etc. you are joining a unique value driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. There are endless opportunities to experiment and grow in any direction that you want and when you grow, we grow. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is a value-driven company that wants to lead the way to a more inclusive environment. We are committed to create an inclusive & diverse workplace with a culture that is dynamic and innovative.
   

  

 We welcome your application regardless of who you are, where you’re from and what you like.
   

  

 We welcome applicants with different backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
   

  

 We welcome all applicants to strengthen our innovative and diverse culture.
   

  

 Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

 This is a full-time position with a placement in Stockholm. Closing date for this recruitment is 15th of October, we do however encourage candidates to send in their applications as soon as possible as we will conduct interviews continuously.

title: Software Developer
description:
Ansök nu
   

  

* Stockholm


 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Vill du vara med och bidra till att skapa den bästa reseupplevelsen för våra resenärer? Vi ger dig som Software Developer chansen att följa med!
   

  

**Om oss**
 Apollo är en ledande researrangör där vi underlättat för skandinaver att komma ut i världen. Först med resor till Grekland till att nu erbjuda våra hela världen till våra kunder. Vi gör det genom vårt charterbolag Apollo, men även genom våra systerbolag Xtravel, Golf Plaisir, Out of Bounds och Lime Travel.
   

  

 Med mer än 35 år i branschen så fortsätter vi att växa och söker därför efter fler Software Developers som tillsammans med oss vill skapa resebranschens bästa kundresa, oavsett om den sker digitalt eller på en sandstrand i Grekland.
   

  

 Sedan 2015 är Apollo en del av den privatägda tyska koncernen REWE med över 300 000 medarbetare. REWE är stora inom dagligvaruhandel, sällanköp, reseindustrin, med mera. En stark ägare som även har fler andra resebolag i Europa inom koncernen som vi samarbetar med.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Är du duktig på .Net, C#, React och Typescript och älskar att resa på fritiden? I så fall kan rollen som Software Developer på Apollo vara perfekt för dig. På Apollo står vi ständigt inför spännande utmaningar inom vår utvecklingsavdelning. Just nu arbetar vi med att byta ut vårt CMS och PIM till Contentful samtidigt som vi bygger en tydligare struktur där både utvecklare och produktägare får större befogenheter och ansvar. 85% av Apollos försäljning sker online och vi lägger såklart stor vikt vid att kontinuerligt förbättra kundupplevelsen och driva innovation för att hitta nya sätt för att hjälpa våra kunder att hitta rätt resa för dem. Våra utvecklingsteam tillsammans med produktägare och UX designers driver tillsammans utvecklingen av sina områden framåt, både på produkt- och teknisk nivå.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med varierande arbetsuppgifter som du har stor möjlighet att påverka. Vi har en kreativ arbetsmiljö med en platt organisation som uppmuntrar samarbete, kommunikation och idéutbyte mellan olika avdelningar på Apollo. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där affären är viktig samtidigt som vi har roligt och en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv.
   

  

 Frågar vi våra utvecklare så beskrivs vi som en organisation där du uppmanas och ges utrymme att lyfta idéer kring hemsidan eller teknikval. Vi ser också till att faktiskt testa nya tekniker, vilket gör att vi ständigt utvecklas och utmanas tillsammans i teamen!

title: Game developer
description:
We are now looking for the best game developer to join us! You have the chance to be a part of creating the best casino games in the online slot industry!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and maintain Casino Games for both desktop and mobile browsers
* The technologies you primarily will work with are HTML5, WebGL, Typescript, Pixi, GSAP and Javascript.
* In a team environment that consists of product management, graphic artistry, sound creation, server development and game mechanics, you will contribute to deliver the best casino games in the market today.
* Your main responsibilities are to make the game graphics come alive with spectacular animations, game flow, game mechanics and sounds according to a result delivered by our game servers.


 Who you are
   

  

* You are a Master Google Searcher that have Stackoverflow as your absolute favourite web site.
* You have practical experience of working with OOP in some language and you have a pragmatic approach to software development.
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in.
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you.
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and take ownership of changes from editor to production system.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Working experience of mobile browsers and knowledge about their limitations and how they work in different ways is a big plus.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Software Engineer
description:
This is a remote position.
   

  

**Job Title:** 
 Software Engineer
   

  

**Company:** 
 Swedish multinational furniture and home goods company
   

  

**Max Price rate (SEK/h): 623**
**Location:** 
 Full-time remote offshore
   

  

**Start date:2024-10-01**
**End date (renewable):2025-04-30**
 Last date to submit: 2024-09-25
   

  

**Background:** 
 Our Observability enablement team is seeking a consultant to work closely with the offerings within the Operational Intelligence Unit. The team operates autonomously, self-organizes, and is self-sufficient, defining how tasks are accomplished together. The consultant will help consumers acquire missing capabilities by bridging capability gaps through research, trying out options, and making informed suggestions on observability tooling, practices, and frameworks.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Hands-on and practical experience with log aggregation related to Cloud Platforms, containerized deployments (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD pipelines.
* Proficiency in using Git and knowledge about GitHub Copilot or other AI-driven tools, with an awareness of their pros and cons.
* Skill in Observability managed as a service using Grafana cloud or similar platforms.
* Extensive knowledge of emerging and rapidly growing technologies, understanding, communicating, and documenting best practices.
* Providing brilliant documentation, thoughtful technical support, and fostering the tech community through the developer forum and Slack.
* Building and improving documentation, demos, scripts, and integrations in the area of Observability to make consumers' lives easier.
* Collecting feedback, logging bugs, and contributing to the product to ensure offerings reflect the needs of the developer community.
* Experience in growing and nurturing open source community projects.
* Experience with event management products and cloud management at scale is beneficial.
* Ability to synthesize and communicate complex technical concepts and scenarios around observability.
* Strong knowledge of Grafana and experience in evangelizing the same to consumers.
* Practical knowledge of monitoring and observability together with software development principles.


**Requirements:**
* 7+ years of experience in Observability and monitoring.
* Experience in log aggregation related to Cloud Platforms, containerized deployments (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD pipelines.
* Proficiency in using Git and knowledge about GitHub Copilot or other AI-driven tools.
* Skilled in Observability managed as a service using Grafana cloud or similar platforms.
* Practical knowledge of monitoring and observability together with software development principles.

title: 3D Frontend Developer
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a 3D Frontend Developer 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS :**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for an experienced Senior Frontend Developer who possesses extensive knowledge in React, TypeScript, and native JavaScript. The ideal candidate will be proficient in using Docker containers to streamline development processes and have familiarity with CI/CD deployments and GitHub for efficient project management. Knowledge of 3D skills, or game development skills, along with knowledge of Three.js, will be considered a strong advantage. We would love to have a optimistic high drive developer to follow our very active 3D team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Design, develop, and maintain responsive and high-performance web applications using React and TypeScript.
* Utilize Docker to create, deploy, and manage containerized applications, ensuring consistency across various environments.
* Implement CI/CD pipelines for automated build, test, and deployment processes, improving development efficiency and product quality.
* Collaborate with DevOps teams to deploy and manage applications within OpenShift clusters, ensuring scalable and reliable infrastructure.
* Utilize Three.js for developing and integrating advanced 3D graphics into web applications (if applicable).
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including pipeline developers, backend developers, 3D designers, and project managers, to deliver high-quality solutions on time.


**Requirements:**
* Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience with React, TypeScript, and native JavaScript (Node/Express)
* Familiarity with Docker containers, including creating, deploying, and managing containerized applications using Docker CLI and Docker Compose.
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools and processes, such as Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or similar platforms.
* Experience with GitHub for version control and collaboration.
* Familiarity with Azure stack, Azure functions, CosmosDB, Azure Busses, etc.


**Education and Experience:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* 4+ years of professional experience in frontend development.


**Required Skills**
* React
* Docker
* Azure Stack
* Docker Compose
* Jenkins
* Docker CLI
* Javascript
* Azure Functions
* EXPRESS
* Github
* Typescript
* Node
* CosmosDB
* CI/CD


**Preferred Skills**
* 3D graphics
* game development
* 3D Modelling
* Web Applications
* 3d Rendering


**Languages**
* English (Proficient)


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at sushilkumar@vipas.se
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How to Apply:**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
**Important note:** 
 Please remember to include your grade transcript along with your CV when submitting your application.
   

  

**The team** 
 : Our team consists of 8-10 engineers and is responsible for an application for delivery of optimization services for large financial institutions. We value working with passionate, talented and nice people who have fun together while pushing ourselves and our systems to improve continuously. Our architecture is clean and modern and based upon patterns like automated testing, modulation, clear boundaries and clear responsibilities, and we believe in continuous and iterative delivery, fail fast, prototyping and continuous feedback from internal and external clients.
   

  

**The impact** 
 : OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade. We keep our eyes on the horizon, always on the lookout for new possibilities and opportunities while staying with our feet on the ground, making sure we deliver rock-solid services that our clients rely on for their daily business and success. Our optimization services create distinct positive impacts on client portfolio risk profiles and operational costs. When our services are executed, global metrics of systemic risks in the financial markets improve significantly. Long-term value to the client is the most important goal of our team, and your contribution in the form of delivery, improvements and innovations can have a significant impact on the financial system.
   

  

**What’s in it for you** 
 : We strongly believe in individual growth and have long experience in guiding early careers engineers in our modern approach to software production, which includes:
   

  

* Rapid, iterative and phased delivery, backed by automated testing and deployment frameworks.
* Streamlined, autonomous and independent teams, optimized and supported for fast change.
* Clean architecture for maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with the team structures and with clear boundaries and responsibilities.
* Innovative culture with a strong focus on exploration and prototyping, where failing fast is a virtue which drives technological and product improvements.


**Software Engineer Position Profile**
 We are seeking a passionate and talented individual to join our innovative and forward-thinking team as a Software Engineer during the summer of 2024. Our company is at the forefront of rapid, iterative, and phased delivery, backed by cutting-edge automated testing and deployment frameworks. We believe in streamlined, autonomous, and independent teams that are optimized and supported for swift adaptability. Our commitment to clean architecture ensures maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with team structures and defined responsibilities.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to the success of our projects using your focus, talent, passion, and grit. We are looking for candidates who hold a Master's degree in Computer Science or have equivalent education or background, and have 3-5 years of relevant work experience. We foster an innovative culture that places a strong emphasis on exploration and prototyping. Here, failing fast is seen as a virtue, propelling technological and product improvements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with cross-functional, autonomous teams for rapid and phased delivery.
* Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility.
* Contribute to an innovative culture through exploration, prototyping, and a willingness to take calculated risks.
* Engage in continuous learning to stay abreast of the latest technologies and industry best practices.


**Qualifications**
* Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent background.
* 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for learning.
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute ideas to a diverse team.


 If you are a tech enthusiast with a thirst for innovation and a desire to contribute to an exciting and fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us as we redefine the boundaries of technology and drive impactful change in the industry.
   

  

**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
Senior .NET Developer - E-commerce & Digital Solutions
   

  

 We're looking for an experienced developer to join our team, where you'll work on projects for clients ranging from startups to large enterprises. You'll have the opportunity to shape the future of e-commerce platforms and digital solutions, while learning from and teaching highly skilled developers.
   

  

 What We Offer:
   

  

* Collaborative Environment: Work in small, tight-knit teams where you'll have influence over decisions and development.
* Efficient Workflow: Thanks to our experienced project managers, distractions are minimized so you can focus on what matters most-development.
* Learning Opportunities: We're committed to continuous learning, both from experienced developers and new hires, ensuring that everyone stays up-to-date with the latest technologies.
* Project Variety: Whether you're working on integrations, building from scratch, or optimizing existing systems, there's always something new to learn.


 Your Role:
   

  

* Focus on backend development with .NET, while also being comfortable working on the frontend when necessary
* Use Vue.js for frontend tasks (but experience with JavaScript, Angular, or React is also welcome)
* Implement custom e-commerce and digital solutions, with a strong focus on Optimizely/Episerver CMS (at least 1 year experience required)
* Work on Azure cloud solutions, leveraging Optimizely Content Cloud and Optimizely Commerce Cloud
* Collaborate on integrations with new and existing systems, providing tailored solutions that drive client success
* Stay at the forefront of technology, continuously exploring and applying the best tools for the job-or building your own if needed


 What We're Looking For:
   

  

* 5+ years of .NET experience
* Strong experience in e-commerce projects and custom digital solutions
* Proficiency in frontend development with Vue.js (or JavaScript, Angular, React)
* Solid knowledge of Tailwind, CSS, and modern frontend best practices
* Experience with Optimizely/Episerver CMS for at least 1 year
* Azure experience is a must
* Fluent Swedish is required for this role


 Why Join Us?
   

  

* Influence and make decisions that shape the project and the product
* Work in a supportive environment where personal development is encouraged
* Collaborate with highly experienced developers and project managers on cutting-edge technologies
* Enjoy the flexibility to find optimal solutions-whether by using the best tools available or creating something new.

title: Android Developer
description:
**Solve complex problems. Decode the future.** 




  





 At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
 



 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
 



 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home.
 



  





**All about the role:** 




 Electrolux is building and strengthening the Digital Experience Organization to deliver highly scalable services and world-class product experiences for our connected appliances.
 



 We are looking for an experienced Android Developer to join the team and take responsibility for contributing to the development of the new IoT Mobile App.
 



  





 Responsibilities will be from writing clean and sophisticated code, developing custom UI widgets and complex layouts with advanced UX, Dealing with complex modular projects, interacting with Electrolux cloud infrastructure and working with a global team spread across different locations worldwide will be yours the day-to-day business.
 



 You will be working in contact with many parties that are involved in the development of Electrolux connectable products such as Digital Products, IT, R&D, Marketing and Design. Problem solving, cooperating with coworkers with different backgrounds, point of views and various cultures will be essential.
 



  





**What you'll do:** 



* Be involved in all aspects of developing new features including user story elaboration, estimation, analysis, design, programming, unit/integration testing and debugging following Agile development practices.
* Build industry leading mobile apps for connected appliances on a global scale.
* Elaborate, estimate, and design for small increments of work just-in-time.
* Commit to completing well-defined work and deliver on those commitments.
* Perform technology evaluation and design spikes.



  





**Who you are:** 




 You are curious, persistent, logical, and clever – a true techie at heart. You enjoy living by the code of your craft and developing elegant solutions for complex problems. If this sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join Electrolux within the Digital Experience Organization!
 



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or related field or equivalent work experience.
* Minimum 4 years’ experience in Android development for consumer-facing mobile apps
* Strong skills in Kotlin, KMM, KTOR, Corotines or similar programming languages
* Ability to write automation tests
* Familiarity with MVVM, REDUX design patters, SOLID principles
* Understanding in Combine, Async/Await technologies.



  





**Where you'll be:** 




 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden).
 



 At our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden) we are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
 



 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
 







**Benefit highlights include:** 




 · Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment.
 



 · Attractive social benefits package.
 



 · Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path.
 



 We look forward to receiving you application!

title: Java Software Engineer - Lifetiming Analytics
description:
**About The Role**
 As a Java Software Engineer at Lifetiming Analytics, your responsibilities will involve maintenance development, data logistics, production refactoring and integration, but may also include the development of new and improved features as well as validation and correctness analysis.
   

  

 You'll also be working with DevOps and service operations efforts that involve the deployment of our Quant service application to our Linux based operating environments in AWS. This includes monitoring and addressing any real-time issues as they occur in order to maintain a high level of availability.
   

  

 As we are at an early-stage in our operational developments, this role will also involve establishing, improving and scaling up structures and solutions pertaining to these needs.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We are looking for a highly motivated engineer with a broad outlook on product development. Maybe you've been working within software engineering for a few years and feel like you might want to take on more product owner responsibilites further on.
   

  

 You are a team player who likes to work together with a team to solve challenges ahead but you're also self-driven and can take your own initiatives when needed.
   

  

 We believe that you have:
   

  

* M.Sc. within Data- or Computer Science or Mathematics
* Deep knowledge in Java and Python programming
* Experience from database technology and SQL
* Documentation and specification skills, and the ability to both document own work and adhere to specifications
* DevOps skills
* Linux server operation including application deployment and provisioning
* Interest in psychology and behavioral science is a plus


**About Lifetiming Analytics AB:**
 Lifetiming is a Stockholm based start-up that designs and develop SaaS products to financial institutions. Lifetiming grew out of an asset manager with an advanced quantative financial analytical and optimizing tool. Lifetiming has lofty goals with expansion in the Nordic region in 2025 and with global ambitions in 2026.
   

  

**Questions and contact**
 In this recruitment, Lifetiming Analytics collaborates with Amendo Tech. For questions about the role, you are welcome to contact Johanna Hallenberg at johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 #IT

title: Embedded UI Developer
description:
**Solve complex problems. Decode the future.**
 At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home.
   

  

**All about the role:**
 As software is playing an increasingly significant role in enabling digital consumer experiences, we are gearing up to become more agile, faster in responding to market demands and quicker in identifying new market opportunities. This involves elevating our appliances to digital, software-defined products in a seamless integration of modular electronics, software, and connectivity platform.
   

  

 We’re looking for an Embedded UI Developer to join us on our journey.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
 As a member of the team developing Electrolux’s next generation digital appliances, you will build the user experience of our future appliance UIs and connected ecosystem. Work closely with the cross functional team to bring new consumer experiences from concept to launch with updates throughout product lifecycle. Bring the technical excellence and collaboration skills we need in the heart of our digital transformation.
   

  

**In detail, you will:**
* Develop software using a modern tech stack for connected appliances, with a primary focus on touch screens and other user interfaces.
* Ship small reliable frequent releases of production grade software together with the rest of the team.
* Create modularized software that is scalable to different languages, cultures, brands, and product categories.
* Work together with other developers, testers, designers, and product managers with shared responsibility for the teams’ success.
* Make our team be the model for a the new normal in appliance user interface development.


**You demonstrate:**
* Collaboration - contributes to a highly collaborative environment that enables a cross functional team to flourish.
* Communication - effectively exchanges information and ideas with confidence and respect, able to demonstrate progress, raise issues and articulate changes on a frequent basis.
* Problem-Solving - able to connect the dots between insights, strategy, and conceptual direction; is outcome - as opposed to task - orientated.
* Adaptability & Resilience - can effectively navigate change, challenges, and setbacks while maintaining a positive and flexible approach.
* Proactivity - eager to learn and grow, sees challenges as opportunities, seeks and - is responsive to - feedback.
* Responsibility - accountable, reliable, and proactive in building systems and handling dependencies, contributing to a trustworthy and effective team dynamic.


**Qualifications** 
**:**
* Proven experience in developing user interface code for embedded devices for both touch screens and less capable UI’s.
* Experience in developing software applications for embedded internet devices that are frequently updated in production.
* Experience in developing touch screen UI code with Dart/Flutter for embedded devices outside mobile phones.
* You need to master at least two of the following competence areas and quickly learn what good looks like for the others:
+ Multi language software integration for embedded environments.
+ Layered software architecture for embedded systems with different chipset performance and UI capabilities
+ Simulation technology for rapid software development of embedded UI’s.
+ Modular test automation for application logic as well as for UI behaviour in embedded products.
+ Using design tokens and design system integration for brand management in graphical UI code.
+ Using systems for translation and internationalization
+ Build pipeline, code analysis, feature flag and analytics tools for modern embedded development.


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarter in Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

 We are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
   

  

 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefit highlights include:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment.
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


 We look forward to receiving you application!
   

  

 As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.
   

  

**Find out more:**
 Electrolux Groupg

description:

 1. Strong Salesforce platform fundamentals like Data Modelling and Designing, Automation Techniques (Triggers and Flows), Lightening Web Component, Modular approach, Custom REST APIs, Apex and Integration, Security by design.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer for AI Enablement
description:
Are you ready to elevate your career and become a part of a team that is transforming the way TRATON delivers exceptional software solutions to our customers? We are on the lookout for several Senior Fullstack Developers dedicated to AI Enablement to join our dynamic team. You will be working in a hybrid work-setting with exciting and complex software development!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 We are dedicated to an inclusive and diverse workplace. You will join a diverse and competent team with a friendly, helpful and inclusive atmosphere. The team has a common vision of the goals and values, allowing us to take our jobs seriously while having fun at the same time. We care for each other’s personal development to learn, grow and evolve, in order to make our deliveries the best we can produce. Be yourself and reveal your talents!
   

  

**Your Role**
 In your role as a Senior Fullstack Developer, you are an essential contributor to our mission of establishing a world-class developer experience. You will help scope, design, and implement AI enablement applications including user interfaces and backend logic for a connected development loop inspired by Platform Engineering. AI enablement encompasses all software which aids the software development process by the use of AI tools such as large language models and other machine learning algorithms. The aim is to enable our engineers to validate and deploy their ideas within 24 hours of conception. Seize this opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and make a significant impact on the industry.
   

  

 You will have the chance to contribute to our “developer platform” and “developer portal” initiatives. These elements are integral to any modern tech organization. You will collaborate with a skilled team to develop and sustain these vital components.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* You will create cloud-based full-stack solutions using modern approaches and best practices to cater business needs of TRATON .
* You will work with peers to develop AI enablement applications in the developer portal.
* Work with Large language models to create applications that create the most benefit to the TRATON software development process.
* You will encourage and improve knowledge sharing by working with peers from across the organization, sharing your experience, learning from others and contributing to our shared knowledge base.
* You will evaluate the performance and quality of our solutions and seek ways to improve them.


**Qualifications**
* Senior-level of competence within fullstack development.
* Interest in the latest AI technologies and trends
* Having deployed applications with Typescript, React Node.js and AWS or other frontend/backend technologies.
* Strong understanding of software development processes, tools, and methodologies.
* Working collaboratively in an Agile/Scrum environment.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.


**Experience with the following is meritorious:**
* Large language models in development and/or production including prompt engineering
* Langchain, express and Rest API:s, kubernetes, CI/CD, playwright, Figma and Gitlab
* Methodologies Test driven development and Behavior driven development and Scaled agile framework (SaFe)
* The full software delivery lifecycle and git based workflows such as trunk based development


**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

**Further information**
 If you would like to learn more about the position please contact Mariette Annergren (Group Manager, EEDCD) at +46855353145.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this role.

title: Software Developer
description:
**Utveckla framtiden med oss** 




 Omegapoint är ett konsultföretag som skapar framtidens digitala tjänster. Vi fortsätter att växa och letar nu efter dig som har några års erfarenhet av systemutveckling.
 



  





**Brinner du för säkerhet inom systemutveckling?** 




 I denna roll blir du en viktig spelare i vårt team och vi tror därför att du är en teamplayer med högt ansvarstagande och kvalitétstänk. Du trivs i kundrelationerna där du är en både strukturerad och engagerad rådgivare och har förmåga att omsätta dina kunskaper i konkreta lösningar. Du är van att agera självständigt och inte rädd för att ta egna initiativ. Som person tror vi vidare att du är öppen, positiv och trivs i en organisation präglad av kompetensutveckling där vi är vassa och snälla mot varandra.
 



  





 Att du vill dela med dig av din kompetens till dina kollegor genom exempelvis mentorskap eller att delta på våra interna kompetensdagar tycker vi är en självklarhet. Vi bygger och stärker vår fina kompetenskultur tillsammans!
 



  





 För den här tjänsten tror vi även att du:
 


* har några års erfarenhet av programmering i Java, C#/.NET eller liknande
* arbetar kvalitetsinriktat och känner dig bekväm med såväl testdriven utveckling som automatiserade tester
* har viss kunskap kring IaC, pipelines och traditionell DevOps/DevSecOps
* eventuellt har erfarenhet av domändriven design
* har arbetat med agila utvecklingsmetoder
* har en akademisk examen eller motsvarande
* bor i eller i närheten av Stockholm och har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift



  





  





**Om oss** 




 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Oslo, Drammen, Köpenhamn, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala, Umeå och Montreal.
 



  





**Vi satsar på dig** 




 På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb. Som konsult hos oss tillbringar du vardagen i uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, men har alltid en välkomnande hemmahamn på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Här ordnar vi mängder av aktiviteter under året för att vi ska utvecklas och ligga i framkant. Det är en del i vår kompetenskultur som bygger på samarbete och en vilja att stärka varandra.
 



  





 Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.
 



  





 Givetvis erbjuder vi även allt det andra som är viktigt, som marknadsmässiga löner, förstärkt föräldralön, anpassade förmånspaket, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och möjlighet till delägarskap.
 



  





 Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du kommer att trivas, utvecklas och ges alla möjligheter till en ljus framtid.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Oneflow builds a SaaS contract automation platform to help businesses modernize the legacy way of working with contracts. Oneflow has since April 2022 traded on Stockholm’s Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market and is a rapidly growing tech scale-up located in the heart of Stockholm. We have created a platform that automates the entire contract process from start to finish, all in one place. Turning clunky, static contracts into helpful, truly digital contracts that feel like magic.** 




  





**The team** 




 We are looking for an experienced Senior Frontend Developer to work on our Oneflow product, a platform that makes it easier to create, send and sign digital documents using electronic signatures. Our teams focus on collaborative problem-solving, valuing open discussions and data-driven decisions to guide their approach, continuously improving our users experience. We encourage our developers to take a strong sense of ownership in their work, knowing that their contributions have a significant impact. Furthermore our developers are involved in every stage of the product development, from feature planning to release, ensuring they have a direct role in shaping our product's success.
 



  





**Who you are** 




 As a Senior Frontend Developer at Oneflow, you will play a key role in developing and improving our web applications, taking ownership and accountability for the creation of new features and the improvement of existing ones. We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced individual with a strong background in React and Node.js who can ensure that our product meets customer needs while maintaining high performance and reliability. You will lead by example, setting and maintaining best practices while actively coaching your teammates. You will collaborate closely as a Product Trio - developer(s), Product Manager(s) and UX designer(s) - in all stages of product development, from discovery to follow-up and optimisation of released capabilities. Besides proficiency in general frontend development, a deep understanding of Javascript module bundlers and build pipelines in CI/CD environments is essential. Additionally, experience with testing frameworks and tools is required.
 



  





**Your background** 




 Strong proficiency in React and Node.js.
 



 Extensive experience with Webpack (or similar) for module bundling.
 



 Expertise in testing with Jest, Enzyme, and React Testing Library.
 



 Experience with setting up and maintaining build pipelines in CI/CD.
 



  





**Technologies to work with** 




 React
 



 Node.js
 



 Webpack
 



 Jest
 



 Enzyme
 



 React Testing Library
 



 Playwright
 



  





**We also value if you have an interest in either of these areas** 




 Docker and infrastructure-related scripts.
 



 Setting up and managing infrastructure-related tasks and automation.
 



  





**How we work** 




 Our team and culture are built on this principle of inclusion and responsibility, which we see as crucial in building a great product.
 



 We strive for a truly agile development environment that promotes getting things done, rather than focusing too much on processes and enterprise tools. This means we typically work in short iterations, regularly going from conceptual discussions to shipped product features in a few weeks. We believe early and honest feedback is the best feedback, both internally and from our customers.
 



  





**Come work with us** 




 We value gender equality and diversity in organization, so we strive for a team that reflects the diversity in today's society. At Oneflow we encourage and welcome applicants who are people of color, LGBTQI+, people with disabilities and those without a college degree. Our recruitment is based on competence.
 



 The recruitment process starts with an interview with Aleksandra from the People & Culture team. After that, you will complete a personality and logic test, then prepare an assignment before your final interview with Sorin, the hiring manager.
 



 Please submit your CV in English.
 



  





 We’re excited to meet you! 💜

title: Fullstack-utvecklare till kund
description:
**Tog du nyligen examen inom IT eller teknik och vill arbeta med en bred utveckling? Vår kund söker nu en nyexaminerad fullstack-utvecklare med intresse fö** 
**r entusiasm för att hålla sig uppdaterad med de senaste teknologitrenderna.** 
****Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv.****
**Att jobba som fullstack-utvecklare**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens energimarknad? Vår kund är i centrum för att maximera värdet av sin portfölj genom att optimera, säkra och förvärva tillgångar och försäljningspositioner. De fungerar som länken till marknaden för handel med el, utsläppsrätter, bränslen, frakt och certifikat för förnybar energi. Med över 450 experter spridda över Sverige, Tyskland och Nederländerna, driver de innovation och hållbarhet på en europeisk nivå.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en passionerad och skicklig Fullstack-utvecklare som vill ta en ledande roll i ett framåtblickande och kreativt utvecklingsteam. Här får du chansen att arbeta med de senaste teknologierna och utveckla lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Är du en självgående problemlösare med en stark teknisk bakgrund och en passion för att skapa användarvänliga applikationer? Då är detta din chans att bidra till en hållbar framtid och vara en del av en bransch i ständig utveckling!
   

  

 Rollen är placerad i Solna.
   

  

**Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**
 Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos kund i Solna med start omgående. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos ute hos kund samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos kund.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Är i början av din karriär och har en kandidatexamen inom informationsteknologi, ingenjörsvetenskap eller motsvarig utbildning.
* Som person är bör du ha en god kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga som både gillar att arbeta självständigt och i team. Du bör vara analytisk och problemlösningsorienterad.
* Starka kunskaper inom JavaScript, samt moderna frontend-ramverk som Angular
* Erfarenhet av backend-teknologier såsom Java och Python
* Kunskap om databaser och datahanteringssystem
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med versionshanteringssystem som Git.
* Har goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Viktigt att du har 1-3 års erfarenhet inom fullstack-utveckling.


**Ansökan**
 Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Micho Shek på micho.shek@nexergroup.com
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Om Nexer Tech Talent**
***Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent* 
 här.**

title: Mainframe Developer
description:
