title: Junior Consultants to Financial Services Advisory - August 2025
description:
*Are you an aspiring Management Consultant eager to work with agile, digital and strategic transformations and truly make a difference in society and for the most prominent players in the financial services sector? Then join us at KPMG Financial Services Advisory. We are growing rapidly and offer great career opportunities!*
 At KPMG Financial Services Advisory you will be part of a truly global organization and team up with inspiring and skilled colleagues as well as our international alliance partners. As Management Consultants we advise our financial services clients on their most pressing concerns and help them on their transformational journeys from strategy and design to change management and value realization. We work alongside top executives and provide digital, innovative and sustainable solutions to their business challenges.
   

  

**Financial Services Advisory**
 We are KPMG’s advisory team for banks, insurers, wealth managers and associated companies in the financial services sector. Our team of Management Consultants - change agents, business developers and Subject Matter Experts - are all united by agile, delivery focused and inclusive ways of working. Together with our clients we change the financial services sector for better.
   

  

 We provide transformational capabilities in complex and strategic areas within Finance, Risk and Operations and in spaces specific to our sector such as Payments and Claims. We support our clients in change initiatives covering system and regulatory implementations, sustainability and the ESG agenda, integrations and separations, cost reductions and efficiency improvements as well as in project and program management. We challenge, develop and elevate to deliver long lasting value. Regardless of objective – digitalization, profitability, sustainability, or innovation, we are the transformation partner for financial services.
   

  

 Our team is based out of Stockholm, Gothenburg and Malmö. You will find additional information about us and our core capabilities on our website: Bank, finans och försäkringsbranschen
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 During your first years at KPMG you will be a part of our advisory-wide learning and development program Talent Growth. In the program, you will acquire knowledge about all business sectors, industry trends and KPMG’s customers. You will learn our tools and methods, gain deep knowledge about our capabilities and delivery models, while also improving your leadership and sales skills. Together with other KPMG colleagues you will be working on exciting client engagements and you will get a mentor and a dedicated performance manager supporting you in your career.
   

  

 ,
   

  

 We are looking for high performing and talented team players who are recent/to be graduates. More specifically, we want you to have:
   

  

* Preferably a master’s degree in business administration, IT and/or engineering or a comparable law degree
* A business, and digital mindset
* Excellent communication skills
* Multilingual proficiency (fluency in English is required, Swedish is an advantage)
* Analytical skills and problem-solving capabilities
* Excellent grades from studies
* Genuine interest in Financial Services
* You are a team player with a genuine interest in seeing customers grow and being part of their journey
* We also value international experiences, prior work experiences as well as other engagements and achievements indicating personal drive, ambition, and passion.


 We look forward to welcoming new colleagues. We offer great fun, a steep learning curve and work alongside senior colleagues and clients addressing their most critical challenges.
   

  

**Join us**
 Apply online as soon as possible, but no later than
 **29th of September.** 

 Please only attach your CV and university grade transcripts. Based on mutual agreement successful candidates will be based in Stockholm and start in August 2025. Please note that in compliance with personal data management regulation (GDPR), we are unable to accept CVs via email.
   

  

 As a first step of the recruitment process, we use capacity and personality tests to increase the objectivity of the selection process. You will receive the tests by e-mail in connection with your application and we will not process your application until the tests have been completed. Please note that we do not offer visa sponsorship. If you move on to the next step in the recruitment process, you will be invited to an Assessment day at our office in Stockholm. The Assessment day will be in the middle of October.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact our Recruiter Amanda Engberg, amanda.engberg@kpmg.se
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 KPMG Financial Services Advisory
   

  

 Do you want to learn more about what we do at Financial Services Advisory? Listen to our colleague Johannes to hear his point of view:
   

  

 Podcast: Life at KPMG - from the view of an economist

title: Transformation Strategist at the Transformation Office, EYTD
description:
Scania R&D is undergoing a transformation towards a deeper cooperation between the different brands within the TRATON group. In parallel there is also a transformation towards a Lean-Agile way of working.
   

  

 A prerequisite to be successful in this ongoing journey is a strong and business-driven Transformation Office. Inspired by the SAFe framework and based on our TRATON values and principles, the Transformation Office works closely with the business as a professional and competent transformation partner.
   

  

 Are you experienced in leading strategic change and ready to challenge yourself and lead transformation strategies that help shape the future of transport? Join us to drive real change!
   

  

**what´s your role?**
 In a more uncertain and complex environment, we believe that the lean-agile way of working contributes to a better way of managing uncertainty. Working in a flow oriented way and with common priorities in the global value stream landscape enable us to increase efficiency and add value to the customer and our organization. You are an important and vital part of the change journey towards a more flow oriented way of working.
   

  

**Some areas of responsibility:**
* Facilitate the build-up of the development value flow landscape, ensure alignment with strategic objectives and maintain the transformation landscape and roadmap
* Lead an identified strategic initiative, coach involved and execute solution
* Take on a request from the business where problem solving expertise is needed to conduct a way forward – Management consulting
* Team up with our lean agile coaches and follow progress within a dedicated area
* Manage our transformation backlog and see to it that we prioritize, learn & adapt and is a step ahead to be able to speak from a place of experience when coaching others
* Fostering lean agile learning and coach all forms of leaders – enabling business agility


**Who you are:**
 With passion and encouragement, you will enable us to make Lean-Agile principles an integral part of the Scania culture to be able to meet our customer needs. You are keen to promote a culture of exploration with a developmental attitude.
   

  

 With a customer focus, you have a large dose of flexibility and curiosity. You have a belief in people, realising the power of teamwork and you dare to challenge when necessary. Acting in an environment of change and implementing new ideas and solutions, even in complex situations, really gets you going.
   

  

 You are the natural connection to all Lean-Agile related topics and influence and coach others to develop and continuously improve a transparent, trusting environment.
   

  

**Skills:**
* Structured, with the ability to plan, set targets short/long term and execute on them
* A leader-mindset with strong communication skills and ability to work in a consultative way, with a proven record of reaching results through cross functional work
* Communicate fluently in English, verbally as well as in writing
* Experience in Lean-Agile
* Experience in the Product Development process
* Very good in Microsoft Office and visualising tools
* Relevant academic education
* Knowledge of change management and a broad methodology library
* Meritorious if you have a wide network within TRATON


 At Scania, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles! We hire for attitude and train for skills.
   

  

**We offer:**
 We can offer you a dynamic workplace with varied and challenging work assignments in a hybrid working setup, which means that you will be able to work from home some days a week if the work permits. We can also offer other benefits such as free training at Scania's own health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, performance bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at a reduced price, the opportunity for a staff car and much more.
   

  

**For more information:**
 Please contact Maria Wiik, Head of Transformation Strategy - EYTD, Transformation Office, R&D and Purchasing, +46 8 553 819 10 or maria.wiik@scania.com.
   

  

 Or Andreas Ljungner, Talent Acquisition Specialist, andreas.ljungner@scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 2024-10-02. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2020, we delivered 66,900 trucks, 5,200 buses as well as 11,000 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 125 billion, of which over 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 50,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com.

title: Game Product Owner (Slot Producer)
description:
Wanna be truly creative and work with a diverse gaming product from seed to actual released product? Maybe sick of releasing just one game every third or fifth year? Come join us as a game producer and be insanely creative and even be able to release your games before you are sick of them!
   

  

 We want to stand out and are not afraid to make games that changes the online slots industry. Are you the person that can drive our products to the next level? Then we are very interested in getting in contact with you. We want you to fulfil one of our two wishes; that you either come from the gaming industry, or even better, are working specifically with slot games and have great knowledge in casino products. You need to have a general passion for games!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Innovative thinker and daredevil that wants to create new and exciting game concepts.
* Making sure that the games teams run smoothly and can deliver badass slots.
* Guide and give feedback on game productions, not just your own.
* Create an excellent player experience and continuously improving our slot games production.
* Ready to work with all aspects of the product – development, math, compliance, marketing and sales.
* Research, play and study slot games and watch market trends and competitors.


 Who you are
   

  

* Passionate to create fun and exciting games.
* A person that can help our amazing team of developers create the best game in the casino market!
* You love to drive and create the game concepts and our way forward, to build a solid games portfolio together with our team.
* Can perfectly switch between working with developers one day and sales and customers the next.
* Excellent organizational and communication skills (a classic!)
* Not afraid to make tough decisions and kill your darlings.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Game production experience within iGaming or Gaming industry.
* Gaming and slots nerd.
* Proven project- and/or people management skills.
* Understanding of mathematical fundamentals of slots.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta, Romania and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. We have no dependencies on other systems, which allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Business Analyst with accounting expertise for major banking project!
description:
Join a dynamic team as a Business Analyst within a leading bank's large-scale transformation project. Leverage your accounting skills and IT knowledge to drive innovative solutions in a supportive and collaborative environment. Welcome with your application!
 


  

  

  

  

 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Finance / Law / Purchase
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 ASAP
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with a team of experts, focusing on replacing legacy systems in a major banking project. Your role will involve managing reporting flows tied to the core accounting systems. You must possess a strong understanding of accounting and be technically proficient in IT, especially within financial systems. You'll be joining a close-knit team of three, collaborating to ensure a smooth transition of the bank's financial reporting infrastructure.
 


  

  

****You are offered****
  

  
* To be a part of an exciting transformation in the banking industry on an international company at the forefront of technology
  
* To join a supportive environment with high employee satisfaction, all working together with ample opportunities for collaboration and growth.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Gather requirements from stakeholders.
  
* Document requirements in business use cases and features.
  
* Be part of the CBP Business Analyst community where the BA’s support each other.
  
* Cooperate with the agile team of PO’s, testers and developers.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Solid experience in a similar role
  
* Experience within finance industry
  
* Experience with reporting
  
* Eperience with complex accounting setup -understanding of reconcilation cross ledgers
  
* Possess sense for details and can translate details into technical requirements
  
* Experience working in an agile project
  
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English
  


  


  

**We see this as meritorious:**



  

  
* SQL skills
  
* T24 experience
  


  


  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:**



  

  
* Are a team player who enjoys collaboration in a multicultural environment
  
* Have excellent communication and analysis skills
  
* Are good at engaging stakeholders at different levels
  
* Honest and transaparent communication
  


  


 In the recruitment process, we will assess both personality and logic tests, and it is also mandatory to provide a background check - Belastningsregistret.

title: Product Specialist (Investment Funds) to one of Sweden’s largest banks
description:
Do you want to play a central role in our client´s exciting and transformational journey to become the most data driven bank in the world? Do you have experience of fund budgeting and accounting and are looking for a workplace where they provide scope for development, and always want their consultants to feel valued, included and be engaged? We are looking for a Product Specialist (Investment Funds) to one of Sweden’s largest banks. Apply today!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Finance / Law / Purchase
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a product specialist you will perform and take responsibility for operational and administrative processes as well as investor reporting and services related to the Funds on the “Bank's Institutional SA platform”.
   

 The Bank's Institutional SA Platform is a Luxembourg based SICAV where the Bank's Investment Management is setting up alternative investment funds in different asset classes for professional investors of the bank.
   

 The responsibilities of the product specialists are manyfold and involves both hands on operational tasks as well as overseeing and supporting service providers in the lifecycle of the fund, including on-boarding of clients, capital draw downs and distributions, investor reporting and continuous contacts with client responsible organizations.
   

 The product specialist is also essential in the constant approvement of the processes around the platform and to improve investor experience to support the constant growth of assets and number of investors.
 


  


  

**Examples of duties performed:**



  

  
* Support in fund accounting process by coordination of the NAV packs work with timing, comments, and necessary formal signoffs.
  
* Support the Transfer Agent process by coordination of the Drawdown process, Distribution process, Dividend process and the Calculations of fees.
  
* Ongoing review and analysis of the budgets of the funds. Coordination of payments of invoices to the fund
  
* Cash management on regular basis.
  
* Coordinate the preparations of various reports to investors, the board of the fund and other internal stake holders
  


  


  

**You are offered**
  

 The banking sector is undergoing fundamental change with digitalization, new technology and regulatory framework that is continuously transforming our business. As the financial landscape is changing, our client is shifting from business-driven IT, to an IT-driven business. The IT-development is run in shorter sprints using agile ways of working, ensuring fast delivery and value in line with customer and business needs. Teamwork, collaboration and leadership is a crucial part of the way business is run at the bank, and we believe that is the key for high performing teams. The bank is a place for people who want to grow and develop. We provide scope for development, and we always want our consultants to feel valued, included and be engaged.
