title: FMC Manager (One year assignment)
description:
*Are you ready to shape the future of Tele2's fixed-mobile convergence strategy? Join our dynamic team and help drive one of the most impactful areas of our B2C business. This is your opportunity to create innovative solutions for our customers, working alongside industry experts in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.*
*This is a one-year temporary position covering parental leave, with the possibility of extension.*
**About The Job (B2C)**
 This role is with B2C (Business to Consumer), one of the key business units of the Tele2 corporation. B2C operates within several key areas concerning our two consumer brands, Tele2 and Comviq. This includes a wide range of activities spanning from digitalization, commercial strategies, marketing, sales, and customer service to TV content acquisition and advanced analytics. As we continuously strive to deliver superior solutions for our customers, we can guarantee that exciting projects will keep on coming.
   

  

 FMC (Fixed Mobile Convergence) is a key pillar in the Tele2’s growth and value strategy for the coming years. The goal is to win the full household on the Swedish market through fully fledged multi-product propositions and excellent customer experience. This role sits in the Business Management where main responsibilities are P&L management and business development, which means it’s at the very heart of the B2C business and where innovation is happening. The role reports to Head of Business Management who reports to Tele2 Commercial Director..
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Lead the business development of FMC concepts and propositions, which entails idea and concept development, market analysis, commercial design, support during product development and eventually go-to-market
* Design value propositions and product offerings to drive revenue growth through cross-sell and upsell
* Collaborate closely with product and IT teams to ensure commercial alignment with demand and development processes
* Provide commercial support on customer journeys, optimizing customer experiences and building strategies to drive FMC through increased product penetration into Swedish households
* Monitor market trends and competitor offerings to ensure Tele2’s FMC value proposition remains competitive


**Who are you?**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you have:
   

  

* Strong business acumen and abilities to develop creative ideas into concepts and commercially viable propositions
* Ability to lead projects with stakeholders from all over the organization
* A sales mindset and eagerness to reach the next level
* Analytical skills and ability to build complex business cases
* Strong communication and presentation skills


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience from the telecom industry or another subscription-based business

title: HR-Generalist
description:
**VIEW Group söker en engagerad HR-Generalist för ett föräldravikariat. Som HR-Generalist kommer du att arbeta brett med HR-frågor med särskilt fokus på rekrytering och employer branding.** 




  





 Vill du arbeta brett inom HR och bidra till att forma framtidens arbetsplats i en växande organisation? VIEW Group söker en engagerad HR-Generalist för ett föräldravikariat, där du kommer att arbeta brett med HR-frågor med särskilt fokus på rekrytering och employer branding.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som HR-Generalist hos oss kommer du att arbeta verksamhetsnära med våra kontor runtom i Sverige. Du blir en viktig kontaktperson inom organisationen, där du svarar på HR-relaterade frågor och stöttar chefer och medarbetare i HR-processer. Du blir en del av ett litet HR-team och rapporterar till HR-chef. Dina arbetsuppgifter omfattar:
 



  




* Ansvar för hela rekryteringsprocessen, från annonsering och search till kompetensbaserade intervjuer och anställningserbjudande
* Employer branding-arbete och kontakt med högskolor/universitet samt närvaro på mässor
* Löpande HR-administration och uppdatering av HR-systemet Simployer
* Chefsstöd inom arbetsrättsliga frågor, rehabilitering och medarbetarutveckling
* Arbete med preboarding-, onboarding- och offboardingprocesser för att säkerställa god medarbetarupplevelse
* Planering och genomförande av sociala aktiviteter



  





 I rollen är du även en ambassadör för våra företagsvärderingar: Care, Commit och Create, och arbetar för att säkerställa att dessa genomsyrar hela organisationen.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har några/flera års erfarenhet av brett HR-arbete och trivs i en dynamisk och händelserik miljö. Du är självgående, strukturerad och initiativrik, och kan prioritera bland många olika arbetsuppgifter. Du är också kommunikativ, positiv och lösningsorienterad.
 



  





 Vi tror att du har:
 



  




* En akademisk examen inom personal och arbetsliv eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av kompetensbaserad rekrytering, helst inom ekonomi och/eller IT
* Erfarenhet av HR-administration och system, gärna Simployer och Teamtailor
* Erfarenhet från konsultbranschen och tidigare arbete med integration vid förvärv är meriterande
* God förmåga att hantera flera parallella arbetsuppgifter och trivs i ett högt tempo



  





 Tjänsten är ett föräldravikariat på 12–14 månader, med start i januari 2024. Eftersom VIEW Group är ett bolag i tillväxt finns det goda möjligheter till förlängning och vidare anställning.
 



  





**Om VIEW Group** 




 VIEW Group består av drygt 800 medarbetare i Norge, Sverige, Finland och England. Vi erbjuder våra kunder tjänster inom ekonomi, lön, IT och telefoni, i kombination med system för ekonomihantering och business intelligence.
 



  





 Hos oss skapar vi framtidens sätt att arbeta med outsourcing! Med smarta digitala lösningar och smidiga integrationer automatiserar vi processer som förenklar våra kunders arbetsvardag. Våra kunder finns representerade i olika branscher och storlekar, från ägarledda till stora bolag och organisationer. Att jobba hos oss innebär att du får tillhöra en bransch i förändring där vi ligger i framkant när det kommer till att arbeta automatiserat och digitaliserat.
 



  





 På VIEW Group får du arbeta med ett gäng härliga kollegor! Med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter blir det en god stämning på kontoret och vi bidrar alla till en utvecklande kultur där vi delar med oss av våra kunskaper till varandra. Hos oss blir du del av ett internationellt och teknikdrivet företag.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





*VIEW Group arbetar efter en kompetensbaserad rekryteringsmodell där arbetspsykologiska tester kan förekomma som en del av bedömningen. På slutkandidat görs även bakgrundskontroll.*

title: Verksjurist
description:
Kvalificerad jurist med intresse för utveckling, digitalisering och dataskydd
   

  

 Är du en kvalificerad jurist med intresse för utveckling, digitalisering och dataskydd?
   

  

 Vi söker nu en verksjurist till rättsenheten vid avdelningen för verksamhetsstöd.
   

  

 Universitets- och högskolerådet, UHR, är en statlig myndighet med ett brett uppdrag inom utbildningsområdet. Vår vision är utbildning, utbyte och utveckling - för alla som vill vidare.
   

  

 Avdelningen för verksamhetsstöd arbetar med och styr myndighetsgemensamma frågor, processer och regelverk som t.ex. årsredovisning och budgetunderlag, interna föreskrifter och kommunikationsstrategier. Vidare ansvarar avdelningen för myndighetsövergripande verksamhetsutveckling. Avdelningen stödjer GD och utgör myndighetens stödfunktion inom områden som ekonomi, inköp och upphandling, löner, juridik, kommunikation, kontorsservice, registratur, arkiv, växel, reception och HR.
   

  

 På rättsenheten arbetar myndighetens jurister, informationssäkerhetsspecialist, arkivarie och registratorer.
   

  

 Vad du kommer att göra/ansvara för
   

  

 Som verksjurist på UHR arbetar du tillsammans med dina kollegor med att:
   

  

* ge stöd i juridiska frågor inom ramen för utveckling och upphandling av verksamhetsstödjande it-system och digitala tjänster,
* ge juridisk rådgivning inom ramen för vårt dataskyddsarbete,
* ge stöd i frågor om offentlighet och sekretess och förvaltningsrätt,
* granska och bistå vid framtagandet av avtal och överenskommelser och
* på ett konstruktivt sätt bidra med dina juridiska kunskaper i olika arbetsgrupper och projekt inom hela verksamheten


 Även andra uppgifter kan förekomma.
   

  

 Du som söker
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* juristexamen eller motsvarande
* flera års erfarenhet av kvalificerat juridiskt arbete från annan statlig myndighet, domstol eller motsvarande
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa rättsliga frågor och har mycket goda kunskaper i förvaltningsrätt, dataskydd och offentlighet och sekretess,
* mycket goda skriftliga och muntliga kunskaper i svenska och goda kunskaper i engelska
* mycket goda kunskaper och erfarenhet av att uttrycka komplicerade juridiska frågeställningar på ett målgruppsanpassat, klart och tydligt sätt
* erfarenhet av juridiska frågor som aktualiseras i digitaliseringsprojekt eller vid utveckling av e-tjänster
* erfarenhet av samarbete med andra kompetenser och av myndighetssamverkan eller motsvarande


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av EU-rätt
* erfarenhet av offentlig upphandling
* genomfört notarietjänstgöring


 För att fungera bra i rollen som verksjurist behöver du:
   

  

* ha god analytisk förmåga
* ha integritet och ha ett gott omdöme
* vara lösningsinriktad och utvecklingsorienterad
* vara ansvarstagande, noggrann och självgående
* ha mycket god samarbetsförmåga


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Vad vi gör och erbjuder
   

  

 UHR har flera uppdrag inom utbildningsområdet vars gemensamma nämnare är att skapa möjligheter till utveckling genom utbildning och internationella utbyten. Vi är cirka 340 anställda i Stockholm och Visby. UHR:s mål är att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där medarbetare och chefer jobbar tillsammans för långsiktig utveckling. Vi erbjuder en professionell och stimulerande miljö med goda möjligheter till personlig utveckling. Vi värnar om en rekrytering fri från diskriminering och ser inte ytterligare anpassningar som ett hinder.
   

  

 Anställningen omfattar heltid med tillträde efter överenskommelse. UHR tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsort är Solna.
   

  

 Våra villkor och förmåner
   

  

 Mer om UHR
   

  

 Ansök och bli en av oss!
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av personligt brev och CV märkt med diarienummer 2.2.1-01348-2024. Sista ansökningsdatum är 11 oktober 2024.
   

  

 Har du några frågor om rekryteringen är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Anna Hörnlund tfn. 010-470 0633. Representant för Saco-S är Kerstin Martínez tfn 010- 470 04 69 och för ST Marianne Källberg tfn 010-470 04 51.
   

  

 Universitets- och högskolerådet har gjort medieval för denna rekrytering. Vi undanber oss därför kontakt med annonssäljare eller andra säljare av rekryteringstjänster.

title: Prisstrateg Supermarket
description:
Supermarketprofilen söker en Prisstrateg!
   

  

 Affärsområde Supermarket har som uppgift att utveckla och stödja profilens cirka 420 butiker. Affärsområdet har ett helhetsansvar för ICA Supermarkets affärsfrågor på strategisk, taktiskt och operativ nivå och är uppdelad i tre funktioner, Marknad, Försäljning & Affärsstöd samt den nya funktionen Pris & Sortiment.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en ny prisstrateg som vill vara med och utveckla vårt prisstöd till butikerna.
   

  

**Det här erbjuder vi**
 Som prisstrateg på Supermarket ansvarar du för att butikernas prisstöd stärker deras konkurrenskraft och lönsamhet. Du kommer att formulera, utforma och realisera profilens prisstrategi, taktik och övergripande KPI:er. Du ansvarar för att skapa en prisupplevelse som på ett långsiktigt och effektivt sätt leder till önskad prisposition på marknaden med god lönsamhet
 *och i samklang med sortimentet* 
 .
   

  

 Det innebär att löpande följa upp prisposition, prisindex och lönsamhet för att sedan analysera uppföljningen och föreslå samt initiera konkreta åtgärder. Att utifrån marknadsutveckling, relevanta trender och konsumentdata inneha huvudansvaret för att profilen ligger i framkant gällande pris.
   

  

 Genom handlarnätverk driva en regelbunden dialog gällande pris samt förmedla och förankra hur prisfrågor kan implementeras i butiksdriften. Att bistå med expertkunskap i dialog med butik kring prisrelaterade frågor. Delta i projekt och aktiviteter som syftar till att stärka kvaliteten samt höja förtroendet för ICAs centrala prisstöd. Du kommer utöver det egna teamet att ha ett nära samarbete med det centrala pristeamet på ICA, samt övriga delar inom profilen där relationen och kontakten med affärspartners är avgörande för att nå ett bra genomförande i butik.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Du har god förståelse för butiksdrift och vad som skapar prisupplevelse hos olika kundgrupper, du förstår relationen mellan pris och sortiment för att driva försäljning och lönsamhet för butik.
   

  

 Du är en proaktiv och resultatinriktad person med hög förmåga att organisera, planera och prioritera. Du är ansvarstagande och är van att arbeta självständigt. Du har en god analytisk förmåga och en fallenhet för att se konsekvenserna av olika val. Du är kommunikativ i både tal och skrift, förtroendeingivande och har lätt för att samarbeta med andra. Du trivs i miljöer där du får arbeta både strategiskt samt operativt, med både stora och små frågor. Du gillar strategier och planer som är uppbyggda av fakta/analys och drivs starkt av att se dem genomföras i butik. Vi söker dig som vill vara med och utveckla, förändra och påverka.
   

  

**Formella krav och erfarenheter**
 Ekonomiutbildning på högskole-/universitetsnivå eller motsvarande kunskap genom erfarenhet.
   

  

 Goda kunskaper inom prissättning och vad som driver lönsamhet och prisupplevelse i butik/detaljhandeln
   

  

 Förståelse för IT system och databaser. Expertkunskaper i Excel. Goda kunskaper inom Office-paketet
   

  

 Relevant arbetslivserfarenhet, gärna inom butik/detaljhandeln, med fokus på strategisk utveckling, konsumentprissättning och konkurrensanalys. Kunskap om ICAs organisation, butikserfarenhet och ett brett kontaktnät inom ICA är meriterande.
   

  

**Sista dag för ansökan**
 29 september 2024. Ansökan via Workday med CV och personligt brev. Urval sker löpande.
   

  

**Placeringsort Solna**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

 Tillträdesdag: Snarast möjligt efter överenskommelse
   

  

**Kontaktpersoner**
 Affärschef ICA Supermarket: Thomas Nilsson, Thomas.f.nilsson@ica.se
   

  

 Ny Chef Pris & Sortiment from 1 november: Nina Ghazi, nina.ghazi@ica.se
   

  

 HR Business partner: Sarah Rostock: sarah.rostock.pettersson@ica.se

title: Finance Manager Swe/Den/Fin & Baltics
description:
Barilla is an Italian family-owned food company. Established in 1877, it’s now an international Group present in more than 100 countries. A world leader in the markets of pasta and ready–to–use sauces in continental Europe, bakery products in Italy and crispbread in Scandinavia, the Barilla Group is recognized worldwide as a symbol of Italian know–how.
 



**“The Joy of Food for a Better Life”** 
 is Barilla’s purpose to bring people closer to the joy of good food and making quality the choice for a better life. It's a commitment from field to fork, to bring to the world tasty, joyful and wholesome products, made with selected raw materials from responsible supply chains. Because what we eat today can change our tomorrow. Because good food is a joy for the present and a choice for a better future.
 



 Now you have the chance to work with one of the top brands in Sweden! We are now looking for a
 **Finance Manager** 
 to join our team based in Stockholm Sweden!
 



 As the Finance Manager for Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Baltics you will play a key role in the decision support processes, acting as a strategic business partner to the Managing Director. Your responsibilities include providing business-relevant information, coordinating strategic and operational planning, implementing a comprehensive reporting system, and ensuring efficient data management. Additionally, you’ll oversee business controlling, financial planning, and analysis, while developing and motivating your team of Financial Specialists.
 



 Furthermore, as a Board member of Barilla Sverige AB, you’ll co-sign financial statements, authorize transactions, and represent the company to tax authorities. You will also be a part of the Swedish Leadership team, where you will utilize your financial expertise and previous leadership experience to promote a collaborative and innovative environment in all areas.
 



  





**Key Accountabilities** 
 :
 



**Strategic Business Planning:** 



* Implement and control short- to mid-term business plans
* Ensure alignment with departmental budgets and corporate objectives



**Financial Impact Monitoring:** 



* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess and influence financial outcomes
* Create comprehensive reports reflecting business activities’ financial impact



**Planning and Forecasting:** 



* Efficiently manage planning and forecasting activities
* Deliver accurate budgets and forecasts, supporting sales and marketing decisions



**Profit and Loss (P&L) Analysis:** 



* Oversee distribution and explanation of P&L analyses to internal stakeholders
* Communicate financial insights clearly and comprehensively



**Legal Entity Administration:** 



* Serve as a Member of the Board of Directors for Company Sverige AB
* Facilitate compliance with tax regulations and oversee contract approvals



**Credit Management and Cost Control:** 



* Monitor credit KPIs and maintain control
* Address expenses and implement necessary adjustments



  





**Your Profile:** 



* **Education** 
 : You hold an academic degree in finance or economics.
* **Experience** 
 : You bring at least 5 years of finance experience, ideally in business or market controlling.
* **Language Skills** 
 : You are proficient in both English and Swedish.
* **FMCG Experience** 
 : Experience in the FMCG sector (manufacturer, retailer, etc.) is a plus.
* **Leadership Skills** 
 : You have a proven track record of leading and inspiring teams and developing a positive culture.
* **Finance Expertise** 
 : You possess varied experience across different aspects of finance, including P&L management, business partner collaboration, and credit management.



  





**Our Offer:** 



* **High Responsibility** 
 : From day one, we entrust you with significant responsibilities. Your impact matters, and we recognize it.
* **Personal Development** 
 : Join us for professional growth and gain global experience in a dynamic international setting, offering extensive exposure and opportunities to excel.
* **Continuous Learning** 
 : We believe in growth. Expect regular feedback and training opportunities to maximize your potential.
* **Flexible Work Arrangements** 
 : Embrace our hybrid approach, and flexible working hours.
* **Diversity & Inclusion** 
 : Engage in national and international projects that champion diversity and inclusion. Your unique perspective matters here.
* **Excellent Public Transportation Access** 
 : Whether you prefer biking or public transport, we have got you covered. Enjoy working in a stylish, modern office which ensures easy access to various transportation options.
* **Motivated Team** 
 : Be part of a dynamic and motivated team. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and mutual support.
* **Positive and Inclusive Culture** 
 : Experience a workplace where positivity and inclusivity are at the core. Our flat hierarchies encourage open communication and mutual respect.



  





**Application** 




 Applications and CVs are sent via our job portal www.barillacareers.com Join us / Current Job Opportunities. If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please get in touch with Talent Acquisition, Sebastian Estrada; sebastian.estrada@external.barilla.com.
 



 We are reviewing candidates regularly so do not wait with your application!
 



 Barilla is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to preventing discrimination and harassment of any kind and providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, or any other classification. Our Stockholm office is the first FMCG company in Sweden to be LGBTQI certified together with RFSL ensuring an even safer and more inclusive workplace.

title: Portfolio Manager till PostNord i Stockholm
description:
Vill du arbeta för PostNords kärnverksamhet inom IT i ett av Sveriges största bolag som erbjuder kommunikations- och logistiklösningar inom Norden?
   

  

 PostNord tar nu nästa steg i en spännande transformationsresa som innebär nya arbetssätt och innovativ utveckling av en modern IT miljö. Är du en förändringsledare som kan driva den strategiska utvecklingsprocessen för vår framtida IT miljö och leda verksamheten genom ett kulturskifte och ett förändrat ”mindsets”?
   

  

**Bli en del av vårt team**
 Som Portfolio Manager hos PostNord i Stockholm är du en del av vårt IT PMO team som är kärnan för att hantera, prioritera samt styra all IT utveckling utifrån ett strategiskt helhetsperspektiv.
   

  

 I rollen leder du tillsammans med teamet vår spännande IT transformationsresa där vi utvecklar och implementerar nya nordiska system för att bli ännu effektivare i vår leverans av paket och brev över hela Norden. Vi skapar nya tjänster och utvecklar befintliga för att erbjuda bättre lösningar till våra kunder.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
**I Rollen Ingår**
* Att hantera IT portföljen med PostNords Epics Program och Projekt samt delta i alla relaterade portföljmöten med interna intressenter. Målet är att styra portföljarbetet i enlighet med PostNords strategi för högsta lönsamhet och förbättra flödet och leveransen av IT utveckling.
* Förbättra våra processer för styrning, prioritering och uppföljning av portföljen.
* Balansera utvecklingskapaciteten i enlighet med strategiska initiativs roadmaps.
* Arbeta datadrivet och säkerställa kvalitet i portföljarbetet.
* Kontinuerligt driva förbättring av portföljarbetet.


**Vi söker dig med**
* Flerårig erfarenhet från arbete som Portfolio Manager eller liknande roller, där du brinner för att driva det strategiska utvecklingsarbetet i gränssnittet mellan IT, verksamhet och affären.
* Erfarenhet av Stakeholder management på olika nivåer i organisationer.
* Erfarenhet av budget och uppföljningsarbete.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska i tal och skrift, svenska är meriterande.


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Lean Portfolio Management i kombination med agila ramverk samt erfarenhet på Portfolionivå inom SAFe. Har du även arbetat i större komplexa organisationer med logistik som en kritisk process är det meriterande.
   

  

 Som person ser vi att du är kommunikativ och har förmågan att presentera komplexa lösningar på olika nivåer i gränslandet mellan IT, verksamheten och affären för att skapa gemensam förståelse. Att skapa struktur genom att planera och prioritera är en naturlig del av ditt arbete. Som person är du trygg och lyhörd och har en förmåga att möta människor i förändring.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Arbeta i en nordisk och dynamisk miljö
* Friskvårdsbidrag & tillgång till kontorets gym och simhall
* Personalförmåner genom PostNords egen personalstiftelse PostNord Plus
* Goda tjänstepensionsvillkor
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter


**Vi gör vardagen enklare**
 PostNord är den ledande leverantören av kommunikations- och logistiklösningar till, från och inom Norden. Vi säkerställer postservicen till privatpersoner och företag i Sverige och Danmark. Vi strävar efter att göra vardagen enklare och mer hållbar för alla som bor och arbetar i Norden. Vi är ansvarstagande, modiga och engagerade, och leder effektivt förändring oavsett om vi leder oss själva eller andra. Vi uppmuntrar lagarbete, uppriktighet och positiva relationer på arbetsplatsen. Vi bygger vidare på våra framgångar och lär oss av både kollegor och misstag. Människor med olika bakgrund arbetar hos oss. Du kommer därför vara en del av en arbetsplats med stor mångfald, vilket bidrar till bättre resultat för verksamheten. Besök oss på postnord.com
   

  

**Ansök**
 Välkommen med din ansökan. Urval sker löpande så ansök så snart som möjligt. Om du har frågor eller funderingar, vänligen maila christina.lundman-lagerstedt@postnord.com
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om våra fackliga kontakter

title: Sustainability Analyst to PostNord Group
description:
Are you ready for a new challenge in a changing and dynamic organization? Do you want to be a key player in the group wide sustainability reporting, analysis and follow up at the Nordics' leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions? We are looking for a person, with a passion for sustainability and extensive knowledge and experience from numerical reporting, follow-up and analysis, to join our Corporate Function Group Sustainability & Climate Impact Office.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As Sustainability Analyst you have a unique opportunity to challenge and drive change and continuous improvement within the sustainability area. The position is broad and varied and you will be part of a team with high ambitions, you report to Head of Group Sustainability & Climate Impact Office. The team is based in Stockholm.
   

  

 It is a strategic role that contributes to the development of sustainability as a key strategic area for PostNord, closely connected to our business and mission.
   

  

**Main assignment**
* Compile, analyse and follow up on non-financial data, with an extended responsibility for the development of the regulatory EU Taxonomy reporting for the Group, climate reporting in line with regulatory and non-regulatory requirements, for internal and external stakeholders.
* Assuring the establishment of calculation methods and calculations in accordance with established standards for analysis, follow up of performance and development of action plans.
* Systematically develop and improve routines for follow up and assessment of key performance indicators, non-financial data and climate calculations in collaboration with internal stakeholders.
* Development of recommendations and executive summaries based on analysis to enable correct and well-balanced executive decisions.
* Develop roadmaps for the groups scope 1, 2, 3 reduction and follow up and measure the group's performance against both operational and Science Based Climate targets.
* Act as the centre of excellence in questions around climate calculations and environmental performance.
* Interact with internal and external stakeholders on sustainability performance, with a particular focus on climate - and environmental performance.
* Represent the company externally, for example in dialogues with the financial market related to the group environmental results.
* Assure insight, recommendations, and information to the development of the group's strategic direction (Sustainability agenda)


**We are looking for**
 The ideal candidate for this position has a strong background from numerical analysis and reporting. You are used to produce professional numerical presentations and always strive to develop and improve the way it is done. Preferably you have experience from working with several markets and internationally. Relevant university degree and good communication-skills in Swedish and English is required. Knowledge and experience from internationally recognized sustainability reporting frameworks and implementation of sustainability policy, standards and procedures is a strong merit.
   

  

 You have a proactive mindset, strong analytical and numerical skills and good organizational understanding. As a person, you are committed, solution-focused and positive. Your approach is structured, and you have an outstanding ability to see the overall picture without missing out on the details. You are curious, enjoy teamwork and do not hesitate to take lead whenever needed.
   

  

**We offer you**
* Work in a Nordic and dynamic environment
* Hybrid workplace
* Great development opportunities
* Good occupational pension conditions
* Health care allowance
* Staff benefits through PostNord's own staff foundation PostNord Plus


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from and within the Nordic region. We ensure the postal service for private individuals and companies in Sweden and Denmark. We strive to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordics.
   

  

 A shared culture with clear leadership is a prerequisite for PostNord to succeed in its vision of making everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. Our leadership criteria are the basis for a shared culture. We are responsible, courageous and committed, and effectively lead change whether we lead ourselves or others. We encourage teamwork, honesty and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our successes and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People from different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com .
   

  

**Does this sound interesting?**
 Click here to apply
   

  

 If you are interested in this position, you are welcome to apply as soon as possible! In this recruitment PostNord is cooperating with Jefferson Wells. If you have any questions dot not hesitate to contact Recruitment Consultant Malin Magnusson 076-780 68 64.
   

  

 For union contact, click here

title: Product Operations Consultant - Universe (Swedish Speaking)
description:
**Job Summary** 




**Product Operations Consultant Universe** 




 Location: Stockholm, Gothenburg, Oslo
 



 Division: Ticketmaster International
 



 Line Manager: Regional Product Operations Manager
 



 Contract Terms: Permanent
 



**THE TEAM** 




 Global Client Support & Operations Organization has the mission to build a global support & operations center of excellence where all processes, tools & best practices are applied to all regions across the globe in order to achieve the highest levels of employee, fan & client satisfaction.
 



**International Client Support & Operations** 
 team, a vertical of this organization, oversees the full event life-cycle services (from build to play-off) we provide to our clients (Promoters, Venues, Artists, Clubs, etc.), in markets that operate on the Microflex platform.
 



 Our clients demand and value high service levels and we believe our people are the foundation to deliver great service. We are fortunate to have the most experienced and skilled operations experts on the field around the globe, regionally and locally, that have a deep understanding of our clients’ needs.
 



 We continuously invest in people development and promote wide collaboration and team spirit to leverage our knowledge and experience to excel in client satisfaction. Mastering our knowledge on our ticketing products is also key in improving our service proposition and solving for our clients’ and local Markets’ needs and challenges day-to-day.
 



**THE JOB** 




 In this role as
 **Product Operations Consultant Universe,** 
 part of the Product Operations team in the North Region, you will be responsible for owning the iterative roll-out of the Universe platform products and features delivered by Ticketmaster Product and Engineering teams, ensuring the Ticketing Product Portfolio can be operated at scale without major friction.
 



 You will become the knowledge expert over the timed entry and GA segment set of products, in some cases being responsible for advanced configurations, and will consult with end users to define solutions to extraordinary client needs and issues. The Product Operations Consultant will also become the first tier of support to internal end users when in need of product understanding and/or product issues and disruptions.
 



 You will collaborate with a wide community of Product Operations Consultants across the different Regions and Markets, facilitated by the Director of Product Operations International, so that product knowledge is built consistently across the board and product roll-out and support processes benefit from our International scale and synergies.
 



 The Product Operations Consultant will continuously engage with Product Management and Product Support teams to understand Product Roadmaps and be able to anticipate roll-out and support efforts at Regional and Market level.
 



**What You Will Be Doing** 




**PRODUCT ADOPTION** 



* Facilitate the implementation of the Universe platform to different clients in the region.
* Learn from the implementation and help streamline the processes to enable rolling out the platform to greater scale.
* Communicate product updates, new features, and functionality.
* Lead the process to implement new products and features within the region.
* Test products and features end-to-end to understand how these behave with the wider product ecosystem.
* Communicate and clarify product updates, known issues, and help identify prospects for beta groups and early adopter groups.
* Own product advanced configurations and translations so that these are embedded in the Regions’ system setup
* Work with Client and Event Support leads in adapting existing or adopting new business processes required to operate the new products and features, reducing the need for unsustainable workarounds
* Work with Education in defining training needs to facilitate product adoption and roll-out
* Own roll-out metrics and adoption KPIs and identify blockers or constraints towards scaling up product adoption



**PRODUCT CONSULTANCY** 



* Develop master knowledge on new and existing ticketing products that form part of Universe and relevant products in the TM1 suite.
* Understand client organization’s long-term business goals and recommend appropriate system and product solutions
* In conjunction with the Client Support Specialists evaluate business processes and assist clients to develop strong best practices
* Bring technical knowledge and first line support to the Regional Client Support teams
* Assist Client Development with RFP responses as it relates to all Ticketmaster products
* Collaborate with the wider Product Operations Consultant community in raising product enhancement requests and defining detailed requirements for these



**PRODUCT SUPPORT** 



* Track Region’s client issues and support via company tracking system Salesforce and provide first/second tier issue fixes when possible
* Bridge issue resolution between Product Support central team and Regional Client Support teams
* Act as the first line of support for specific clients when warranted due to business needs
* Facilitate Regional product advancement through communication of client feedback to Product and Engineering teams
* Coordinate and act as Business Consultant with Product software installation and upgrades
* Coordinate with install timeline, data extraction, and checklist
* Troubleshoot system, connectivity, software and hardware issues and escalate in a timely manner



**WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW (or TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS)** 




 You will be required to demonstrate a high-level of business acumen together with a strong level of sector knowledge, relating to the international ticketing and entertainment business.
 


* Demonstrated success in providing product consultancy and support services in a Market for entertainment clients.
* Formal project management skills or extensive experience working in projects
* Master knowledge of ticketing platforms and products within the timed entry and GA segment
* Experience providing excellent leadership in leading and growing successful operations and cross-functional teams in an international or global organization.
* Strong written and verbal communications skills in English and Finnish, Swedish or Norwegian.
* Strong Microsoft Word, Powerpoint and Excel skills
* Experience with building and maintaining strong relationships with stakeholders.
* Experience in ticketing, live events, promoting, e-business, media or entertainment industries preferred.
* Demonstrated leadership ability.
* Innovative and flexible approach – thrive to find solutions outside the box.
* Not accepting the status quo, working with a sense of urgency to deliver results.



**You (behavioural Requirements)** 




 The following attributes determine how the role will be carried out and are required to be a success:
 


* Carefully weighs the impact of a broad range of related issues or factors.
* Makes high quality decisions in a timely manner, considering both the immediate and long-term consequences of decisions.
* Asks appropriate questions to ensure understanding, to generate new ideas and innovative solutions.
* Responds with flexibility and resilience when faced with multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, or rapid change.
* Organises time effectively and plans for future needs, maximising the use of available resources.
* Highly motivated team player who contributes to an atmosphere in which people work together enthusiastically and effectively, and produce outstanding results
* Clearly conveys goals and expectations to others; steps forward to confront difficult issues.
* Paves the way for change, diminishes fear and persuades others to let go of resistance.
* Cultivate successful interdepartmental relationships ensuring growth of areas.
* Demonstrates ethical behaviours.
* Relationship Management & Collaboration- building and fostering strong trust-based relationships with clients and internal partners across the organisation. A skilful and collaborative team player with the ability to network effectively up, down and across the business. Intuitive and empathetic.



**LIFE AT TICKETMASTER** 




 We are proud to be a part of Live Nation Entertainment, the world’s largest live entertainment company.
 



 Our vision at Ticketmaster is to connect people around the world to the live events they love. As the world’s largest ticket marketplace and the leading global provider of enterprise tools and services for the live entertainment business, we are uniquely positioned to successfully deliver on that vision.
 



 We do it all with an intense passion for Live and an inspiring and diverse culture driven by accessible leaders, attentive managers, and enthusiastic teams. If you’re passionate about live entertainment like we are, and you want to work at a company dedicated to helping millions of fans experience it, we want to hear from you.

title: Interimsjurist
description:
*Är du jurist och vill ta konsultuppdrag? Skapa en profil på vår konsultplattform!* 




  





**Om Boardtalk Legal & Compliance** 




 Boardtalk är din partner för rekrytering inom Legal & Compliance, Real Estate och Ekonomi & Finans. Med över 20 års erfarenhet av rekrytering erbjuder vi skräddarsydda lösningar inom juridik, HR, finans och fastighet och gör ca 200 tillsättningar varje år. Vi skapar långsiktiga och framgångsrika partnerskap genom ömsesidigt förtroende.
 



  





 Nu söker vi dig som vill ta interimsuppdrag genom oss!
 



  





**Om vår konsultplattform** 




 Boardtalk Legal & Compliance rekryterar och hyr ut jurister inom samtliga tjänsteområden. Våra kunder är framför allt medelstora företag inom bank & finans, fastighet och IT. Vi har även myndigheter och intresseorganisationer som kunder.
 



  





 Sedan 2002 har vi byggt upp ett omfattande nätverk av underkonsulter och tillsätter idag majoriteten av alla uppdrag med konsulter från nätverket. Genom att skapa en profil på vår konsultplattform kommer du få erbjudanden om nya uppdrag från oss. Uppdragen varierar i längd och kan omfatta allt från ett par timmar i veckan under en tillfällig arbetstopp till heltid i 6-12 månader. Vi erbjuder också externa DPO-lösningar och konsulter för andra compliancefunktioner.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Du kan antingen agera underkonsult eller bli anställd av oss under uppdraget. Vi samarbetar även med advokatbyråer, juristbyråer och nischade konsultfirmor med anställda konsulter - allt för att ge vår kund den bästa resursen och lösningen.
 



  





*Vill du veta mer om hur vi arbetar med interimslösningar? Kontakta affärsområdeschef Carl Berg på* 
***carl.berg@boardtalk.se***
*eller 072 229 51 42 eller på LinkedIn. Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!*

title: Senior Legal Counsel - Regulatory
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Legal team** 





 The Legal team at Trustly is the guardian of Trustly’s regulatory licenses in Sweden, France and the UK, consisting of experts in regulations on payment services, privacy & data protection and commercial law. Currently a team of ten and growing, based in Stockholm, Paris and London.
 








**About the role** 





 As a Senior Legal Counsel - Regulatory, you are part of a dynamic legal team providing expertise to the product & tech and commercial teams in all things involving payment services regulation and commercial contracts. You are a professional in legal risk assessment, keeping presence of mind in complex and urgent situations, and giving knowledgeable recommendations to decision-makers across the whole organization. The position is based in Stockholm.
 





  




**What you’ll do** 
* Safeguard the regulatory licenses of Trustly, including manage the relationships with the regulators with care and diligence
* Interpret payment services regulation, including translating this into meaningful and useful information for the product & tech team when it is designing innovative and human-centric payment products
* At times, support the commercial team in drafting and negotiating commercial contracts
* Support the organization in solution-oriented handling of various legal issues



  




**Who you are** 
* Holds a Master of Laws Degree
* 4-6 years of relevant experience from a payment services company, a commercial law firm, and/or supervisory authority is preferred (knowledge in PSD2 and future regulations on payment initiation services is a plus)
* Passionate about the payment industry
* Excellent English and Swedish language skills
* Driven and curious with a positive can-do attitude
* Terrific team player






  




  



 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.

title: Associate Lecturer/Lecturer (EF) in Visual effects (VFX) – School of Art & Design
description:
This Job is based in Australia
   

  

* Employment Type: Continuing, Full Time (35-hour week)
* Remuneration: Level A ($88,290 - $117,718) or Level B ($123,620 - $145,730) + 17% Superannuation and annual leave loading
* Location: Paddington, NSW
* We are in the process of building and expanding Faculty Arts, Design & Architecture (ADA)


**About The Faculty**
 We are currently seeking expressions of interest for a variety of academic positions across the Faculty of Arts, Design & Architecture (ADA) because we are building and expanding. The Faculty is guided by our ADA2051 vision: through creativity, collaboration and inclusion we seek and solve problems to improve life on earth.
   

  

 At UNSW ADA our diversity is our strength. We span over 60 subject areas - from media, education, construction, textiles, social work, languages, music – and much more. Organised across six Schools and multiple research centres we support world-class facilities and strong industry engagement on our Kensington and Paddington campuses. We equip our students with the skills and experience to think creatively and critically and translate their knowledge and experience into exciting careers.
   

  

 Link below to watch a video of our Dean for Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture - Claire Annesley: UNSW ADA Recruitment.mp4
   

  

**Why The Role Matters**
 UNSW is seeking an Associate Lecturer/Lecturer Education Focussed role (EF). This person will support academics and specialise in education and devote their time to delivering high-quality teaching and pursuing initiatives to enhance the educational experience of our students. Those who are appointed to this prestigious specialism will be expected to successfully drive educational excellence within the university’s teaching and learning communities. The role of Associate Lecture/Lecturer reports to Head of School, Edward Scheer.
   

  

**Accountabilities**
*(please review the Position Description for a full list of Accountabilities)*
**Level A -**
* Demonstrate and continuously develop a well-defined teaching philosophy that inspires student learning.
* Demonstrate a well-defined teaching philosophy that inspires student learning.
* Conduct classes, assess student learning achievements and support students in line with UNSW policy and with guidance of more senior academics.
* Design and develop learning activities and resources, and assessment and feedback using a range of appropriate approaches and learning environments with the support of more senior academics
* Contribute to the development of experimental approaches to teaching and learning led by more senior academics.
* Support learning progression with students as individuals (through such activities as one-to-one consultation) and as a cohort (through general course related advice) to achieve positive learning and employability outcomes for students.
* Manage course administration, including academic quality assurance.


**Level B –**
* Demonstrate and continuously develop a well-defined teaching philosophy that inspires student learning.
* Conduct classes, assess student learning achievements and support students in postgraduate and undergraduate courses in line with UNSW policy.
* Design and develop learning activities and resources, and assessment and feedback using a range of suitable approaches and learning environments.
* Initiate the development of experimental approaches to teaching and learning with the support of more senior academics.
* Support learning progression with students as individuals (through such activities as one-to-one consultation) and as a cohort (through general course related advice) to achieve positive learning and employability outcomes for students.
* Manage course administration as Course Authority, including academic quality assurance.


**Skills And Experience**
 To be considered you will hold Australian Working Rights or Australian Citizenship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment.
   

  

*(please review the Position Description for a full list of Skills and Experience)*
* A Masters degree or PhD (preferred) in a related discipline, and/or relevant work experience.
* High-level understandings of the principles of animation, visual effects, and related interdisciplinary practices, and the theoretical underpinnings of these principles.
* Detailed understandings of screen-based visual languages, including fundamentals of storytelling, as well as expanded and experimental media arts practices.
* Knowledge of industry standard 3D animation and visual effects pipelines including animation workflows, character rigs, storyboard interpretation, concept art, compositing, motion capture, procedural FX, and real-time production workflows.
* Experience with Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop and After Effects.
* In-depth knowledge of visual effects and real-time production programs such as Nuke, Unreal Engine, and Houdini.
* Detailed understandings of theory and practice in the areas of media arts, animation, and visual effects, and a commitment to fostering experimental approaches to practice.


**Benefits And Culture**
 People are at the core of everything we do. We recognise it is the contributions of our staff who make UNSW one of the best universities in Australia and the world.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Flexible Working Options (work from home, flexible hours etc)
* Career development opportunities
* 17% Superannuation contributions and additional leave loading payments
* Additional 3 days of leave over Christmas period
* Discounts and entitlements (retail, education, fitness)


 For further details on the benefits, please visit https://www.jobs.unsw.edu.au/lifestyle-benefits
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Submit both a Cover Letter and CV online via the UNSW Job Board before Sunday 6th October 2024 by 11:30pm. Please ensure your Cover Letter addresses how your skills and experience align to this position (1-2 pages maximum).
   

  

**Get In Touch**
 If you have any queries about the role, please contact Edward Scheer at e.scheer@unsw.edu.au.
   

  

 If you have any queries about the recruitment process, please contact Persa Tzakis at p.tzakis@unsw.edu.au.
   

  

 Please note, any applications sent to the contacts above will not be accepted.
   

  

 UNSW is committed to evolving a culture that embraces equity and supports a diverse and inclusive community where everyone can participate fairly, in a safe and respectful environment. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and encourage applications from people of diverse gender, sexual orientation, cultural and linguistic backgrounds, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background, people with disability and those with caring and family responsibilities. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.
   

  

 The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.

title: SAP S/4 Consultant, Order To Cash - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Vill du vara en del av ett snabbt växande globalt team med all sin karriärpotential och bidra till att nå våra tillväxtmål? Om svaret är ja, har vi en perfekt roll för dig!
   

  

 Vi söker en erfaren SAP Order To Cash (O2C) konsult till vårt team. I rollen har personen som vi söker helst god förståelse för lösningar inkl. SAP-konfiguration, och -anpassning samt dokumentation och testning inom S/4HANA O2C. Erfarenhet av andra moduler som MM anses vara meriterande.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder en fantastisk möjlighet att lära sig och växa med utmanande kundcase hos oss på Tietoevry som är ett av de ledande företagen inom SAP-verksamhet i Norden. Vi vill främja kreativitet så att du kan komma med dina idéer och påverka vår verksamhetsexpansion. I denna tjänst, och i Tietoevry i allmänhet, får du arbeta i en global miljö med professionella kollegor. Vi arbetar i nära samarbete med våra globala nordiska kunder inom detaljhandel, tillverkning och skogsindustri
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Designa och implementera SAP Best Practices inom SAP SD och Order To Cash processer
* Arbeta nära intressenter för att förstå och tillhandahålla verksamhetskrav- och funktionsspecifikationer.
* Applikationssupport för SAP O2C-området
* Delta i kundworkshops


**Kvalifikationer:**
* Beprövad erfarenhet som SAP O2C-konsult inom systemkonfigurering.
* God förståelse för O2C-processer
* Utmärkt problemlösningsförmåga för att lösa utmaningar som du och ditt team ställt inför.
* Förmåga och drivkraft att bygga och utveckla goda relationer för att skapa ett starkt samarbete.


**Språk:**
* Utmärkt kommunikations- och presentationsförmåga på svenska och engelska (andra språk är meriterande)


**Vad du kan förvänta dig av oss:**
 Vi erbjuder dig spännande och utvecklande projekt som ger dig möjlighet att arbeta inom olika branscher så som detaljhandel, tillverkning och skogsindustri. Du får skapa framtiden med oss i en växande och snabbt utvecklande sektor. Som leverantör av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster tror vi på att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att möjliggöra din framgång. Vi erbjuder våra konsulter en öppen kultur där vi trivs med att jobba och utvecklas tillsammans i team och våra konsulter utvecklar i projekten sina individuella färdigheter. Vi använder en flexibel hybridarbetsmodell som en del av vårt arbetssätt. På Tietoevry strävar vi efter ett öppet klimat där vi lägger stor vikt vid att se nyfikenhet och lärandet som en viktig del av arbetslivet.
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag.
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
*Tietoevry värdesätter mångfald och vi välkomnar sökande av alla kön, åldrar, förmågor, etniciteter, inriktningar, övertygelser och bakgrunder.*
**Om Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry skapar målmedveten teknik som återuppfinner världen för gott. Vi är ett ledande teknikföretag med ett starkt nordiskt arv och global kapacitet. Utifrån våra kärnvärderingar öppenhet, tillit och mångfald, arbetar vi med våra kunder för att skapa en digital framtid där vi, konsultbolag, våra konsulter och kunder går igenom en betydlig transformation.
   

  

 Våra 24 000 experter globalt är specialiserade på moln, data samt mjukvara och bistår tusentals företagskunder och offentliga kunder i mer än 90 länder. Tietoevrys årliga omsättning är cirka 3 miljarder euro och bolagets aktier är noterade på NASDAQ-börsen i Helsingfors och Stockholm samt på Oslo Børs. Bekanta dig med vad vi gör.
   

  

 Skapar målmedveten teknik för att återuppfinna världen för gott
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Social Media Manager - Swedish Market
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Focusing on Sports and Casino, the Social Media Manager will be at the forefront of our Swedish social media strategy, creating market-specific plans, tailoring content for Sweden and driving initiatives to meet and exceed key performance indicators (KPIs).
   

  

 This role requires a resourceful, creative, and passionate person who can harness their direct experience in managing social media channels and digital campaigns.
   

  

 You must have excellent creative, written and communication skills, with the ability to create, plan and prioritise. The ideal candidate will be flexible and self-motivated whilst being able to multi-task, and adaptable.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will be an expert in the digital and social media content space, but with tested sound judgement and a healthy sense of pragmatism about how to quickly implement creative campaigns and content. Someone who is across the latest industry developments, trends, and best practise within digital and social media marketing.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Create and deliver content plans for the local market through social media channels.
* Delivering work along all aspects of social media; content, community management, insights and activation.
* Strong copywriting and planning skills with attention to detail.
* Understanding of Digital and Social Media content best practices and how to implement them.
* Experience of translating and localising content from English to Swedish.
* Creative thinker, articulate and persuasive and able to communicate operational initiatives and outcomes.
* Ability to communicate and coordinate effectively with multiple business units and local markets.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* A proven track record of creating and executing successful social media campaigns
* Knowledge of the Swedish sporting, cultural world and Swedish language.
* Ability to design and edit social multimedia content
* Experience with social media management tools – e.g. Sprinklr, Sprout, etc.
* Use of creative tools, Adobe Photoshop/ Express etc
* Data analysis and data-driven decision-making skills
* Excellent time and self-management abilities
* Ability to think outside-the-box and create and execute innovative social media and PR campaigns.
* Analyze data and metrics to measure social media campaign performance and adjust strategies accordingly
* An understanding of the betting industry would be beneficial, but not essential.


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*
   

  

 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

title: Finnish speaking Customer Advisor to Pre-Collection (Part-time)
description:
*Do you want to be a part of an innovative bank with a welcoming atmosphere? Nordax is the right choice for you.*
 We are now looking for new part time colleagues, as we call "temps", to Collections. Collections is an outbound business where you will mostly call out to customers who for some reason are lagging with their payments. In some cases there are simple solutions, in other cases you will need to set up a long-term plan together with the customer. You will also, to some extent, receive incoming phone calls from customers who contact us themselves. Connected to the calls there is some administration but the role itself is telephone-based, and therefore we are looking for you who enjoy talking to customers and who sees every call as an opportunity to help!
   

  

 Working at collections also means many development opportunities. You will get to work with a wide range of clients, giving you the opportunity to develop your communication skills and your ability to solve problems. You will also have the chance to learn about credit and risk management, which is valuable knowledge that can benefit your career in the future.
   

  

 At Nordax, you will be part of an open and welcoming climate. Our collaboration is characterized by a big heart for the customer and the team and that we share our knowledge and join hands to make our customers even more satisfied.
   

  

 The work as a whole consists of providing professional service based on each unique situation by:
   

  

* Doing certain administration linked to the calls
* Collaborating with other internal functions
* Handling customer matters by phone regarding overdue invoices


**Important For You To Know**
 This position starts with a full-time introduction for two weeks in the office. In order for you to have good conditions to start working, attendance as high as possible is required during these two weeks. After the two weeks, while you are still in training, the shifts will be scheduled during daytime in the office. When you can work independently, it is also fine to work evenings, weekends and remotely.
   

  

****To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:****
* Communicative and empathetic
* Results oriented
* Flexible


**We Are Looking For You Who**
* Live in Sweden, near Stockholm
* Have worked with service/people in some way, preferably over the phone
* Speaks and writes fluently in Finnish and English
* Can work part-time for at least 1-3 years
* Can work a lot of hours in the first two weeks of each month when we are busiest
* Can work during holidays when the full time staff have vacation


 It is important that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.
   

  

**Our Offer**
* A non-hierarchical organization
* Opportunities to develop
* Breakfast every week
* Fun activities
* Feedback culture, coaching leadership and a culture where we care for each other!


**Practical Information**
* Start: By agreement
* Place: Stockholm, Gävlegatan 22, possibility to work remote
* Employment form: Temporary employment
* Salary: Hourly 💰
* Hours: 07:30-16:00, evening and some weekends


 Take the chance and join us on a developing journey at the bank with big 🧡 and fast 👣.
   

  

**What happens when you have submitted your application?**
 The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. Typically, you can expect two interviews before reference and background checks. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨
   

  

 Nordax Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave.

title: Senior Partner Sales Manager ENT Greenfield
description:
**Description**
 Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry? Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for world class candidates to help drive opportunities with our valued partner network in Sweden. You will be at the heart of key trends like artificial intelligence, machine learning, sustainability and cloud-driven industry solutions, helping customers with state-of-the-art technologies on AWS to innovate even faster.
   

  

 As Senior Partner Sales Manager for Enterprise Greenfield, you will build and execute a Partner go-to-market strategy for a set of defined Greenfield customers in your territory and manage a pipeline of co-sell opportunities to reach your target. You will deliver on our strategy to help customers achieve their business objectives and accelerate adoption of Amazon’s infrastructure web services, in which Partners play a pivotal role. The ideal candidate has the ability to build effective, multi-level relationships (including C-level) with customers and partners, creating a preference for AWS.
   

  

 You will collaborate with partners to serve and create value for customers within the Enterprise Greenfield segment. You will lead interactions with partners to create net new pipeline and accelerate joint customer opportunities, leveraging the benefits of the AWS Partner Program.
   

  

 As Senior Partner Sales Manager, you enjoy teamwork and building bridges. You will become an integral part of the AWS Sales Team and collaborate closely with AWS account teams, solution specialists and solution architects, as well as the Partner Development team and Marketing. You will own and execute the partner go-to-market strategy for customers in your territory.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Build the Partner Strategy for the Enterprise Greenfield target markets in the Nordics, in line with the AWS strategic direction.
* Define partner ecosystem and relevant partner solutions to address key customer use cases, which accelerate innovation and cloud adoption for our customers.
* Coordinate and drive execution of the business plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. account teams, solution architects, business development teams, marketing, etc.).
* Manage and drive joint co-sell engagements between consulting partners, technology partners, Account Management and Partner Development team.
* Work with AWS account teams in a highly collaborative operating model to develop pipeline.
* Collaborate with partner bid desk teams to support partners on how to best leverage APN programs, solution support and pricing constructs
* Liaise with the Partner’s field sales organization, channels and end customers to help create and drive revenue opportunities for AWS.
* Ensure that AWS is the partner’s preferred cloud computing platform across all product lines.
* Prepare and lead business reviews to the senior management team.
* Provide support during contract negotiations and serve as a liaison to the legal group.


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Entrepreneurial “builder” mentality Proven ability to deliver results amid ambiguity and change
* 10+ years of technology related (partner-) sales experience to coordinate field teams and develop and close high-profile deals
* Experience working with Consulting companies and/or ISV and SaaS vendors
* Experience in developing detailed annual Go-to-market plans and a successful track record to achieving and exceeding quota and key performance metrics
* Effective verbal and written communications skills, excellent presentation skills and ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences - including senior executives.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Existing network with Enterprise customers and GSI, SI, VAR, ISV and SaaS community in Sweden
* Prior experience working with Nordic AWS Consulting Partners and/or Technology partners
* Experience working within cloud solutions
* Specialization in industry verticals (for example Manufacturing, FSI, Retail)
* Understanding of AWS, cloud architecture and infrastructure


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2749335

title: IT Support
description:
**Job Title:**
 IT Support
   

  

**Job Description:**
 Are you passionate about providing IT Support and ensuring a good and stable service? Are you a process person at the core, open to helping your colleagues and to making sure we deliver a good service? We are now looking for IT Support to join dentsu Sweden. Welcome in with your application!
   

  

**About The Role**
 In the role of IT Support, you will solve daily tickets and provide onsite IT support to our end-users at dentsu. You will work with our other IT Support team member in Sweden to support our offices in Stockholm & Gothenburg, you will also work closely with our IT-Support Team in Northern Europe & rest of EMEA.
   

  

 Join us for a job where you'll collaborate with industry experts in various fields such as software development, sales, digital strategy, and more. You'll be supported by a dedicated IT Support team that prioritizes providing top-notch assistance to all our colleagues. We pride ourselves on fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone's contributions are valued and respected.
   

  

  

  

**What are we looking for?**
* You have 1-2+ years of experience in IT Support.
* You have experience supporting Windows (10 &11), experience supporting Mac (OSX & iOS) is an advantage.
* You can communicate in Swedish & English (both orally and in writing)
* You are a good communicator and team player.
* You thrive in an international working environment.
* You know Image deployment, primarily JSS / Dep for Macs and Microsoft SCCM for PC.
* You have skills and understanding of AD and network patching.
* You have a good knowledge of Office 365 products and Microsoft Service Manager.
* Experience in ServiceNow – Ticket, Change Management system is a plus.


**About Dentsu**
 Dentsu Sweden AB is part of a global communication network with 47,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting clients. Naturally, we offer wonderful colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, and unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, all individual's strengths are encouraged, and you have the opportunity to be yourself, grow, and reach your full potential. Within all brands in the dentsu group, we constantly work on developing our employees and leaders, thus offering good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic, and international levels. We are happy to provide more information about the above during any potential interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base, and we actively work on our social and environmental responsibilities as employers and fellow human beings.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 Some of the Perks We Offer:
   

  

* Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
* Collective agreement
* Occupational pension
* 5000 SEK in wellness allowance
* 30 days of vacation entitlement
* Great career and development opportunities
* The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within dentsu


 The position is full-time permanent employment with a 6-month probation period, located at our Stockholm office. Interviews are conducted continuously, and the start date is in August/September according to the agreement. We look forward in receiving your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions, please reach out to:
   

  

 Linda Ye, Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 linda.ye@dentsu.com
   

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Dentsu
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Contract Type:**
 Permanent

title: IT-koordinator
description:
*En av Sveriges ledande telekomföretag söker en IT-koordinator för ett konsultuppdrag. Kundens vision är att hitta smarta och obegränsade lösningar tillsammans med engagerade medarbetare som är redo att ansluta sig till uppdraget för ett samhälle utan begränsningar.* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Vi söker en dynamisk och pålitlig IT-koordinator för en av våra kunder inom B2C IT. I denna roll kommer du att direkt stödja kundens B2C IT-ledningsteam och arbeta nära ansvariga för att hantera och koordinera uppgifter inom deras ledningsgrupp och över deras team. Om du trivs i snabba miljöer, älskar struktur och tycker om att koordinera och driva projekt framåt, kan detta vara den perfekta rollen för dig!
 



  





**Vad du kommer att få göra** 




 Koordinera, följa upp och hantera uppgifter inom kundens ITB2C LT och i samarbete med supportfunktioner.
 



 Samla in, förbereda och paketera material för möten, presentationer och rapporter.
 



 Över tid vara Delivery Manager för IT-leverans.
 



 Bidra med struktur över teamen och projekt.
 



  





**Vad vi letar efter** 




 Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande (både i tal och skrift).
 



 Stark organisatorisk förmåga med ett strukturerat förhållningssätt till uppgiftshantering.
 



 Kunskaper i PowerPoint och Excel för presentationer och dataanalys. Bra på att paketera information.
 



 Förmåga att hantera flera uppgifter, prioritera effektivt och leverera under snäva deadlines.
 



  





**Vem du är** 




 Gillar att samarbeta.
 



 En pragmatisk problemlösare med ett flexibelt förhållningssätt till att ändra prioriteringar.
 



 Självständig och driven.
 



 Pålitlig, med stark känsla för ansvar och uppmärksamhet på detaljer.
 



 Hög integritet.
 



  





**Erfarenhet vi hade uppskattat extra** 




 Tidigare erfarenhet som Management Trainee och/eller projektledare är ett stort plus.
 



 Erfarenhet från IT.
 



 Självsäker och beslutsam.
 



 För denna roll är det huvudsakligen on-site på kundens kontor i Kista.
 



  





**This is Market Partner** 




*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, whom you like, no matter where you come from, or what you look like.*
